tourName: Atacama Desert photography tour, Chile
generalInfo:
Stretching out under some of the clearest skies on earth, the Atacama desert offers a photographic playground like few others. On this photo tour, you’ll travel into the heart of this wilderness, where salt flats ripple into distant volcanoes, geyser fields steam in the dawn, and flamingos trace pastel-coloured lagoons.

Your base will be the desert town of San Pedro de Atacama, a remote outpost framed by eldritch rock formations, luminous skies and quiet evenings that invite reflection. Each day we’ll chase the desert’s differing moods: the just-sunlit folds of Valle de la Luna, the high-altitude lakes reflecting snow-capped peaks, the geyser fields at sunrise, and salt-crust flats under towering skies.

What’s more, this is a trip that pairs the grand scale of landscape with unexpected detail: vicuñas grazing beneath volcanoes, horned coots by tranquil lakes, and herds of guanaco silhouetted in changing light. You’ll be supported every step of the way, in a small group, with a photographic guide who knows how to unlock the region’s visual potential.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Calama and transfer to San Pedro de Atacama. Settle into your desert base, explore the town’s adobe streets, and enjoy your first sunset shoot under the high desert skies.
Venture into the surreal landscapes of Valle de la Luna. Photograph dramatic rock formations, sand dunes, and the shifting desert light. Sunset brings rich tones perfect for wide-angle landscapes.

Travel to the high plains and discover colourful altiplanic lagoons. Capture flamingos, vicuñas, and reflections of snow-capped volcanoes. Stop at traditional villages to frame local life against the dramatic scenery.
Rise before dawn to visit the El Tatio geysers. Steam plumes and first light create a cinematic landscape for photography. Later, enjoy natural hot springs before returning to San Pedro.
Spend the day at the vast Salar de Atacama and nearby salt flats. Focus on textures, geometric patterns, and wildlife. Golden-hour light illuminates this otherworldly environment.
Enjoy a final morning of shooting in the desert, capturing the light and shadows of the town and surrounding landscapes. Transfer back to Calama for departure or extend your stay independently.

tourName: Chile 2 week holiday
generalInfo:
This two-week classic Chile itinerary takes you from the country’s most iconic highlights to some of South America’s most spectacular scenery, offering a journey of striking contrasts. Sail through hidden fjords of Patagonia, wander the bohemian streets of Valparaiso, and witness the otherworldly salt flats of the Atacama, all in one unforgettable trip.

Begin in the vibrant capital of Santiago, before flying into the heart of Patagonia, where Torres del Paine reveals its forested valleys, windswept glaciers and jagged peaks. Afterward, explore the arty port hub and UNESCO city of Valparaiso, with its creative charm and colourful hills. End your classic itinerary in the Atacama Desert, home to vast salt flats, sand dunes, rocky plateaus and Mars-like terrain, as well as deep ancestral roots.

Excursions are a mix of private and small-group tours, led by expert local guides. Accommodation has been hand-picked by us to ensure a comfortable and enriching experience. This trip can be tailored to your interests, so let us know your preferences.

dayInfo.description: Santiago: Welcome to Chile’s capital Santiago. Transfer to your boutique hotel in upscale El Golf, renowned for tree-lined streets and sophisticated vibe. Let your local guide, show you the city’s cultural highlights on a private walking tour and learn about Santiago’s past and customs, see its iconic buildings and take in views of the Andes backdrop.

Puerto Natales: Journey by air to the charming port town of Puerto Natales. During your stay, enjoy a full-day boat navigation through Patagonia’s hidden fjords and journey to the Balmaceda and Serrano Glaciers. Only accessible by water, this day trip offers a secluded and tranquil glacier experience.

Torres del Paine: Transfer to the captivating Torres del Paine National Park and explore its highlights on a full day excursion. You’ll stay at a hotel located inside the park, and conveniently placed on the shores of Grey Lake, surrounded by epic scenery. Your stay is at leisure, and the hotel can help you organise a range of excursions to ensure you explore the park your own way. From classic hikes, like the Base of the Torres, to lesser-known hiking trails such as Pingo Valley, and boat navigations to Grey Glacier.

Valparaiso: Fly back to Santiago and travel to the nearby Valparaiso, a UNESCO port city. With an expert local guide explore the historical and cultural highlights of Valparaiso, ride a funicular to the hilltops for dramatic Pacific Ocean views and marvel at the bright, patchwork-coloured houses that adorn the hills.

Atacama: Fly north and escape to the driest non-polar desert in the world: The Atacama Desert. With an expert guide, witness the magic of Moon Valley at sunrise. Visit a traditional ayllu community to share Atacameñan food and learn how families farm and preserve their deep-rooted culture. Explore the desert’s-coloured salt lagoons: float effortlessly in Cejar Lagoon, marvel at the perfectly round freshwater lagoons of Ojos del Salar and end the day at Tebinquiche Lagoon, where the salt flats glow with pink, purple and orange beneath the Andes sunset.

Santiago: Say goodbye to Atacama and fly south to Santiago, where you’ll spend one final night before heading home. If you would like to make the most of your time in the capital, we can arrange a guided tour or recommend some wonderful places to eat- just let us know your preferences.

tourName: Chile active adventure holiday
generalInfo:
Embark on your own slow-paced adventure to Chile's greatest sights; the buzzing cities of Santiago and Valparaiso; the stunning glaciers, mountains and lakes of Patagonia; and the incredible otherworldly landscapes of the Atacama Desert.

You'll have plenty of time in each destination, to witness first the classic highlights, and then the lesser-known gems that only an extended stay allows (and we believe makes for a more memorable and fulfilling experience). Hike, bike, kayak, horse-ride, or buckle-up for a 4x4 drive or boat excursion.

All of our trips can be tailormade from scratch, so take this as an example of what is possible and "Enquire Now" so we can create your very own dream adventure.

dayInfo.description: SANTIAGO & VALPARAISO - Start your Chilean adventure by exploring the buzzing capital Santiago, and the colourful coastal city of Valparaiso, full of artistic, cultural, and gastronomic activities. We can also spend a day visiting some of Chile's famous vineyards on the road inbetween.

PUERTO NATALES - Head south to the gateway to Patagonia, where you can take a small boat cruise to visit nearby glaciers, horseride under the mountains, and enjoy a traditional barbeque lunch on a working estancia.

TORRES DEL PAINE - Checking-in to our charming lodge in Chile's most iconic national park, the next few days are yours to choose from a range of outdoor activities. Torres del Paine is a trekkers paradise, but there are also boat trips, 4x4 drives, horseriding, and even kayaking on offer here.

ATACAMA - We end this epic trip with a full week amongst the mind-blowing landscapes of the Atacama Desert. From the steaming El Tatio Geysers at dawn to sunsets over Moon Valley, via blinding salt flats, coloured lagoons, hot springs, flamingos... you can even climb a volcano! Hike, bike, or take a hot air balloon. This is a very special place indeed to end your adventure.

tourName: Chile activity tour
placesVisited: Lake Tagua Tagua, energy efficient lakeside lodge, full board accommodation, local staff and guides, choice of included and optional activities, such as trekking, horse riding, kayaking and rafting
generalInfo:
This fantastic four day activity holiday in the Chilean Lake District is ideal for families and small groups seeking an adventurous few days whilst travelling in South America. Set within the gorgeous Puelo Valley, you’ll be invited to stay in an energy efficient eco-lodge on the shores of Lake Tagua.

The natural surroundings alone will set your heart racing however, when combined with kayaking, horse riding and treks in the mountain foothills, you’ll be hard pushed to find anywhere else half as exciting in the whole of South America.

Alternative activities, such as river rafting, fly fishing and cultural excursions, can also be arranged with full board facilities and airport transfers from Puerto Montt providing a stress free experience for families looking for a break by the lake.

As it’s situated within the confines of Tagua Tagua Park your accommodation has been designed with sustainability and environmental preservation in mind with just 18 guest rooms providing a few home comforts amongst the mountains and lakes of southern Chile.

The onsite restaurant is always particularly well received after a good day spent outdoors with locally sourced specialities, such as lamb, trout, shellfish and wild boar, often to be found on the menu.

If you’re interested in undertaking any of the excursions below, as part of a tailor made holiday during December and March, please let us know at the time of making your reservation. Many thanks.

Trekking
Tagua-Tagua waterfalls – rated as easy to moderate – duration 3 - 4hrs
Alerce Lagoon – rated as moderate – duration 7 - 8hrs
Andean Lakes – rated as moderate – duration 6hrs
Arena Beach – rated as easy – duration 3 - 4hrs
Llanada Grande – rated as easy – duration 5 - 6hrs

Mountain biking
Mountain bike trip to Puelo – rated as moderate to difficult – duration 6 – 7hrs

Kayaking
We use Prijon double and single sea kayaks which are built to European safety standards. All kit including life jackets and protective wet bags are included.

Kayak to the Big Falls – rated as easy – duration 3 - 4hrs
Kayak to the Tagua Tagua Crossing – rated as easy – duration 7hrs

Rafting
All rafting equipment including wetsuit, buoyancy aid, boots, PFD and helmet is included. A kayak guide also accompanies this trip to ensure all safety measures are in place.

Raft on Puelo River – rated as moderate to hard – duration 4hrs

Horse riding
Ride to South Puelo – rated as easy – duration 3 – 4hrs

Cultural excursions
Puelo Riverside – rated as easy – duration 7hrs
Rural Experience – rated as easy – duration 5 - 6hrs
Boat tour – rated as easy – duration 3 – 4hrs

Our excursions are all accompanied by an English-speaking local guide who is also equipped with an emergency radio and first aid kit. Excursions are designed for all ages, although we recommend a minimum age of 11yrs for anyone undertaking kayaking, rafting, horse riding and trekking to the Alerce Lagoon. Please get in touch if you require any more info about our optional excursions and/or our accommodation's environmental practices.

dayInfo.description: Transfer Puerto Montt airport or Puerto Varas to Tagua Tagua - half day excursion - Lodge. (L,D) Pick up from Puerto Montt Airport or hotel in Puerto Montt/Puerto Varas. Transfer and transfer to the Lodge, located 146 km South East of Puerto Montt. From Puerto Varas we head east along the Southern shore of Lake Llanquihue for for 45 Km to the village of Ensenada. From here we will head south along a paved road heading towards Ralun for approximatley 35 Km. From Ralun we continue along a gravel road for 60 Km to Lake Tagua Tagua, passing through the village of Cochamo. At Puereto Canelo, on the shore of Lake Tagua Tagua, you will board the Mongo II launch to cross the lake to the lodge. The whole journey should take just over 3 hours. On arrival welcome drink and if in the morning, this will be followed by lunch. In the afternoon your chosen activity.You need to preebook your choice of excursion. After the activity, return to the lodge. Set menu dinner and accommodation.

Full day excursion - Lodge. (B,L,D) Buffet breakfast at the lodge. Today is a brand new day to enjoy a new experience. Come with us and get immersed in the beauty of nature or go and follow the trails of the settlers to learn about the pioneering history through their true descendants. You need to pre-book your choice of excursion.

Full day excursion - Lodge. (B,L,D) Buffet breakfast at the lodge. Our experienced guides have spent years getting around the valley and they know well its geography, weather and people. Most of our staff are born and raised here, and along with our solid network throughout the valley, we know its secrets and wonders. So come and join us today. It’s time for a new experience! You need to pre-book your choice of excursion.
Transfer to Puerto Varas or Puerto Montt airport. (B) Buffet breakfast at the lodge. At the time agreed, transfer to Punta Canelo where our van to the airport in Puerto Montt is waiting for us.

tourName: Chile adventure holiday
placesVisited: Santiago, Valparaiso, San Pedro de Atacama, Salt Flats, El Tatio geysers, Lake District, Puerto Varas, Torres del Paine National Park, Optional: Magdalena Island penguin colony, zodiac tour to Balmaceda Glacier
generalInfo:
Spend a couple of weeks flying from one highlight to the next on a Chile adventure holiday and you’ll soon gain newfound respect for local people living and working in the shadow of the Andes.

Chile’s coastline stretches for 4300kms, about half the length of South America, and, as such, flying over some of the driest and least hospitable environments on the planet really does make sense.

From the saline sparseness of Chile’s vast salt flats, Salar de Atacama, to the plentiful valleys and wine estates within the centre of the country, this Chile adventure holiday leaves nothing to the imagination when it comes to jaw-dropping landscapes and expansive variety.

Heading south, into Patagonia, takes you deeper into the thundering waterfalls and infinitely blue lakes of Torres del Paine National Park as your Chile adventure holiday climaxes amongst the vast fields of ice, shimmering glaciers and stunning solitude of Patagonia before entering the city of Punta Arenas and flying back to the bright lights of Santiago.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Chile! There’s plenty of adventure on your trip, but today’s all about settling into the hotel. There will be a noticeboard in the hotel reception with details of where and when the group welcome briefing will be held. Your tour leader then ensures a big Chilean welcome by arranging a group dinner. Accommodation: Panamericana Hotel Providencia (or similar) Upgrade to a suite today – speak to your sales representative for more details

In Santiago de Chile, the best features of a vibrant, modern metropolis are paired with the old-world charm of a former colonial capital, and the city tour this morning will introduce you to both sides. We’ll begin with a visit to the presidential palace, named La Moneda because the splendid building once housed the national mint. Many other sights in the historic centre are clustered around the always-bustling Plaza de Armas: the impressive cathedral; the beautiful old post office; the Palacio de la Real Audiencia, now home to the National History Museum; and the Casa Colorada, once the Spanish governor’s residence. We also discover the “green lung” of Santiago, the Metropolitan Park on the “Cerro San Cristóbal”, a hill in the middle of the city with a huge white statue of the Virgin Mary crowning its summit. In the afternoon we travel to the beautiful Maipo Valley south of Santiago and visit Viña Santa Rita. We’ll join a tour through the winery which will introduce you to Chilean viticulture. You will not only find out more about different grapes and their characteristic tastes but also learn the production from the harvest, the storage in wine barrels to finally ending up as a wine in a bottle. Visit the wine cellar built in 1880 by French architects – today’s historical monument and taste three different wines. Accommodation: Panamericana Hotel Providencia (or similar) Upgrade to a suite today – speak to your sales representative for more details

After breakfast, we transfer to the airport to board a flight to Puerto Natales where we spend the night. We have a short orientation walk and then the afternoon will be free for you to explore on your own. Please note, depending on the flight schedules on some departures we may need to fly to Punta Arenas and transfer by road to Puerto Natales. Accommodation: Hotel Lady Florence Dixie (or similar) Upgrade to a superior room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

This morning, we drive into Torres del Paine National Park for adventure in a spectacular environment. This is a busy day of travelling and walking taking in unforgettable views of the Towers and exploring the eastern side of the park. Today, we visit Laguna Azul; from this glacial lagoon, we have one of the most beautiful views of the Torres peaks. We also visit the Rio Paine waterfall, which is located in a spectacular landscape overlooking the peaks of the famous Torres del Paine. Continue to Laguna Amarga for more breath-taking views before arriving at our hotel on the western side of the park. Accommodation: Hosteria Pehoe (or similar)

Today, we enjoy one of the classic walks in the heart of the park. We’ll reach the starting point after a scenic drive in the park. The walk today is approximately 2.5 hours, and the terrain is fairly flat, with only one steeper part, but the incredible views of the Cuernos del Paine in front of you throughout make it worth it! We also visit the Salto Grande waterfall and continue along the shores of Lake Nordenskjöld until we arrive at the Cuernos viewpoint, with unforgettable views of the Torres Massif. On the way back, we stop at the visitor centre to learn about the origin and history of the park. This afternoon is free to relax at the hotel or enjoy optional excursions in the area. Accommodation: Hosteria Pehoe (or similar)

Another day in Torres del Paine National Park, this time to explore the western highlights including Grey Lake. This deep lake, fed by the glacier of the same name, is filled with icebergs which have splashed down from the massive ice flow. Weather permitting, today we join the Grey Glacier navigation, a three-hour boat excursion which takes us to Grey Glacier, the largest in Torres del Paine National Park. To get to the boat, we have a 1.25mi (2km) hike through lenga forest, crossing the Pingo River and to the tip of a narrow peninsula along the beach at the southern end of the lake. We cruise up the Grey Lake toward the glacier, which reaches 30m (100ft) high and 3.7mi (6km) wide at its terminus. Pieces of ice both large and small regularly break off from the front of the glacier, falling into the water with a crack and a splash. It is a unique opportunity to get a close-up view of this amazing blue glacier. After the excursion, we’ll visit the Milodon Cave on our way back to our hotel in Puerto Natales, arriving around 5.30pm. Accommodation: Hotel Lady Florence Dixie (or similar) Upgrade to a superior room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Transfer to Puerto Natales Airport and fly to Puerto Montt, the capital of the Lake District. This is a long travelling day that will likely require an early start depending on the flight schedules. On arrival in the Lake District, we drive for 30 minutes to Puerto Varas on the shores of Lago Llanquihue. Depending on flight arrival time, we can enjoy a brief tour of the City of the Roses, named for the tremendous variety of roses all over town. If we’re scheduled to arrive on a later flight, we recommend that you buy food at the airport as you may not have many options on arrival at the hotel. Accommodation: Hotel Solace (or similar)

Set out this morning for a full day inside the Lake District. We drive along the shore of Lago Llanquihue and enjoy breathtaking views of the Osorno and Calbuco volcanoes. Our first real stop will be at the Saltos de Petrohue, where cooling lava from the Osorno Volcano formed a series of rapids and waterfalls. Together they create an impressive sculpture of extruded volcanic rock shaped by thousands of years of river flow. At Petrohue, we board a boat for a short cruise of Lago Todos los Santos. The lake is surrounded by high mountains and the lower slopes are thickly forested. As we pull away from the landing and the source of the river Petrohue, the view is quickly stolen by the tremendous size and proximity of snow-capped Osorno Volcano behind us. After our boat tour, we drive to the lower reaches of the immense Osorno volcano where we can hike in the lower lava fields of the volcano. We also visit the Green Lagoon (Laguna Verde) before we return towards Puerto Varas in the afternoon. Please note, the order of the itinerary today may change depending on the weather conditions. Accommodation: Hotel Solace (or similar)

In the morning, we fly to Calama near the Atacama Desert, where we transfer to our hotel in the town of San Pedro de Atacama. After check-in, our tour leader offers a short orientation tour of the town for anyone who wants to join. At dusk, we set out to the Valley of the Moon. This bizarre lunar landscape is set ablaze with colour at sunset, the strange rock formations framed by the Licancabur Volcano. We stay until the sun goes down to enjoy the array of colours before returning to San Pedro. Depending on the flight times, this visit to the Valley of the Moon and the short orientation tour of the town might be moved to the following days instead. Accommodation: Hotel Don Raul (or similar)

Set off towards the Altiplano Lagoons (Lagunas Altiplánicas) and stop en route at the village of Socaire, set at 10,558ft (11,480ft/3,500m). The village is noteworthy for its peculiar rough-stonework architecture, and the inhabitants still live by age-old methods of planting terraced fields with corn, wheat and potatoes. After, we continue for about another 19mi (30km), climbing an additional 3,281ft (1,000m) in altitude to reach the highland lagoons of Miscanti (14,270ft/4,350m) and Miñiques (13,450ft/4,100m). The two volcanoes of the same name are visible in the background (almost 19,686ft/6,000m high). The twin lagoons are a deep blue, each framed by a white salt crust, which creates a memorable contrast to the yellow highland grass all around. It is completely silent here. Even the duck species that breed here, the foxes, and the grazing vicuñas (a type of camelid), respect the majestic silence. We then visit the Salar de Atacama. A salt lake of huge proportions (1,158 sqmi/3,000sqkm), it is covered by a thick layer of snow-white salt crystals, caused by the evaporation of the lake water. The largest lithium deposits in the world are found here, but the salt pan is also home to several flamingo species, including the Andean, Chilean and James, which feed on the micro-organisms in the saline lagoons. Look out for these beautiful birds and other species in their natural habitat at Chaxa Lagoon, which is part of the Reserva Nacional de los Flamencos. After the excursion, we return to San Pedro. Please note, the order of the itinerary may change today. Accommodation: Hotel Don Raul (or similar)

We have to get up very early to arrive at the El Tatio Geysers, which are more than 14,108ft (4,300m) above sea level, in time for sunrise. The fountains, which can shoot up to 33ft (10m) high, occur when the morning sun melts the nightly ice caps that form over the hot springs. The first rays reflect an array of colours as they mix with boiling geyser jets to create strong contrasts of steam and light. Around midday, we return to San Pedro for some free time. Returning along the same route, accompanied by the Andes and their volcanoes, we will make a short stop on the way at the Putana wetland, where we can observe different species of birds in front of the Colorado volcano. There is an optional astronomy tour tonight that highlights the southern sky. This excursion should be booked in advance of departure as availability is limited and does not operate during full moon. Please speak to your sales representative if interested. Accommodation: Hotel Don Raul (or similar)

Transfer to Calama airport for our flight to Santiago (flight times can vary) to enjoy our final evening in Chile. Accommodation: Panamericana Hotel Providencia (or similar) Upgrade to a suite today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Our trip ends this morning after breakfast. However, if you’d like the adventure to continue, speak to your sales representative about joining our Easter Island extension. Alternatively, you may want to extend your stay in Santiago, the cosmopolitan capital of Chile.

tourName: Chile family holiday, tailor made
generalInfo:
Our Chilean family adventure takes you through the country’s most remarkable destinations, offering child-friendly activities and accommodations. Both adults and children will fall in love with the breathtaking landscapes, outdoor adventures, and the warm hospitality of the Chilean people.

Your journey begins in Santiago, a city nestled on the slopes of the mountains, where you can hike through leafy parks to the summit for panoramic views, wander the captivating streets, and take a cooking class to sample delicious Chilean cuisine.

Next, spend a day discovering the vibrant coastal cities of Viña del Mar and Valparaíso, both steeped in history, before heading to San Pedro de Atacama, the gateway to the famous Atacama Desert. Here, you’ll embark on a fascinating ancestral caravan excursion across the desert and even have the chance to try sandboarding on the dunes of the Valley of Death.

Your adventure continues in the Lake District, where you’ll visit the stunning Petrohué Waterfalls in the Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park and enjoy a boat trip on Todos Los Santos Lake, surrounded by towering volcanoes and lush forests. You’ll also spend a night in Villa Peulla, a charming mountain village that serves as an adventure playground, offering activities such as ziplining, trekking, and horseback riding through rolling farmlands and sparkling lagoons.

dayInfo.description: You’ll be met on arrival at Santiago International Airport by our Travel representative and escorted to your private vehicle. Your driver will transfer you to your accommodation for the next three nights.

Enjoy a buffet breakfast this morning, before meeting your English-speaking guide at the hotel for your Santiago cooking adventure. You’ll begin in Mercado Central (Central Market) to pick up ingredients, then head to La Vega Central, a market located in the Recoleta neighbourhood, famed for its fresh supply of fruit and vegetables. Inside the cooking workshop you’ll meet your chef, who will guide you through the preparation of traditional Chilean recipes, revealing some of his culinary secrets.

After breakfast, you’ll be picked up your English-speaking guide to begin your full day excursion to Viña del Mar and Valparaíso. You’ll head towards the central coast of Chile, making a stop at a vineyard in the Casablanca Valley to enjoy a glass of wine. You’ll then stop at Viña del Mar, known as ‘The Garden City’, due to the myriad of parks and gardens found across the city. You’ll visit the beautiful Carrasco Palace and Quinta Vergara, one of the most famous parks in Viña del Mar, where you can roam the gardens to see the Palacio Vergara and the Quinta Vergara Amphitheater. Next, you’ll visit the famous flower clock of Viña del Mar, before arriving in Valparaíso, a UNESCO World Heritage city strewn with multi-coloured houses, parks and national monuments. Stroll through Plaza Sotomayor, a historical square overlooking one of Chile’s major sea ports. In the afternoon, you’ll return to your hotel in Santiago.

This morning you’ll be met by your private driver and transferred to Santiago airport, for your domestic flight to Calama airport. On arrival at the airport, you’ll be met by your driver and transferred to your accommodation for the next three nights. Soak up the scenery as you cruise through the famous Atacama region. This afternoon, you’ll embark on a special ancestral caravan excursion. Your local guide will take you to the outskirts of town, where you’ll begin your walk, retracing one of the circuits used by the old caravan communities in the Atacama Desert. You’ll be joined by camels as you walk, and you’ll learn about the customs of these ancestors and how they domesticated the camel.

Today is yours to spend at your leisure. Today continue your exploration of the stunning Atacama region. There is a range of adventurous experiences as a way of exploring the area. Go trekking or bike riding through the glittering salt flats, soaring volcanoes, bubbling geysers and ancient rock formations. Hike the iconic Valley of the Moon, take an archaeological tour of a Tulor village dating back to 800 B.C.

Today you’ll have the opportunity to go sandboarding in the Valley of Death. After breakfast, you’ll be met by your guide and transferred to the valley, where you’ll find sand dunes of more than 120 metres, towering under the blazing blue sky. In the evening, you’ll return your accommodation, where you’ll enjoy a delicious meal from the onsite restaurant, featuring fresh produce sourced from nearby farms. Sample authentic Chilean dishes and gourmet international cuisine, complemented with fine Chilean wines and signature cocktails.

After breakfast, enjoy a final morning exploring the beautiful Atacama desert. Soothe any sore muscles with a dip in the outdoor swimming pool, or a traditional Altiplanico therapies at El Chañar Spa. You’ll then be transferred to Calama airport for your domestic flight to Santiago. On arrival at the airport, you’ll be transferred to your accommodation for the night in Santiago.

Holiday Inn Santiago is located within walking distance of Santiago airport, so you can enjoy a buffet breakfast, before easily transferring to the airport for your domestic flight to El Tepual International Airport, located in Puerto Montt. On arrival at the airport, you’ll be met by your private driver and transferred to your luxury accommodation for the night. This afternoon, you’ll embark on an excursion to the Petrohué Waterfalls, located in the Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park. Your guide will drive through Ensenada, the easternmost port on the Llanquihue Lake, before continuing along the Petrohué River Valley, flanked by dense forest and ancient lava fields. Stroll through the woodlands, taking in the extraordinary views of the snow-capped Orsono volcano, before heading to the town of Petrohué, nestled on the banks of Todos Los Santos Lake. Your guide will transfer you back to your hotel in the evening.

Today you’ll venture to Villa Peulla, a gorgeous mountain village in Chile’s Lake District. Enjoy a buffet breakfast, before meeting your private English-speaking guide at your hotel and heading to the south shore of Lake Llanquihue. Here, you’ll board a boat and sail Todos Los Santos Lake for nearly two hours, with spectacular views of the Osorno, Puntiagudo and Tronador volcanoes. You’ll then arrive at Villa Peulla, a small ecological village of 120 inhabitants, where you can visit the Bridal Veil waterfall, or go trekking in the beautiful alpine scenery. You can also enjoy lunch and other outdoor activities at your accommodation for the night. Kids will love kayaking, horseback riding, fishing, and the games room, or you can simply relax in your cosy room, featuring hardwood furnishings and large windows to soak up the stunning mountain views.

The morning is yours to explore the beautiful Puella area. Thrill seekers will love the canopy excursion, where you zipline through the forest on an 800 metre long course, reaching heights of up to 15 metres in the evergreen forest of coigüe trees, next to the Bridal Veil waterfall. You can also go horseback riding, starting on a cattle field on Riggi Farm, and passing through evergreen forests, valleys and rivers in the Vicente Perez Rosales National Park. You’ll be accompanied by specialised ecotourism guides, and the activity is suitable for all ages and experiences. Kids will also love the horse riding excursion to El Encanto Lagoon, an enchanting stream of crystal clear waters. You’ll learn about the flora and fauna of the region, while taking in the beautiful alpine environment. In the afternoon, you’ll return to Puerto Varas, checking into your accommodation for the night.

Enjoy a final buffet breakfast, before getting picked up by your private driver and transferred to Puerto Montt airport and return to Santiago. You will spend your final night in Santiago before flying home the next day.

Sadly today is the end of your Chile Family Holiday, you will head to the airport for your onward flight. After 11 adventurous nights spent exploring Chile’s most extraordinary landscapes, natural wonders and luxury retreats, you’ll be leaving with plenty of stories and wonderful memories to look back on as a family. If you’d like to continue your intrepid family holiday, you can fly to Argentina to explore more of the Patagonia region and see the remarkable Iguazu Falls, the largest waterfall system in the world. You can also head to the end of the world in Ushuaia, where you can board a cruise ship for Antarctica, the world’s last great wilderness.

placesVisited: San Pedro de Atacama, Valle de la Luna, Atacama Desert, Licancabur Volcano, Andes mountain range, swim in the Tatio spring waters, Santiago de Chile, Valparaíso, Laguna Verde, Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park, Puerto Varas, Torres del Paine National Park
generalInfo:
Over the length of 12 days, this Chile highlights holiday takes you from sparse desert to wild, snow-capped mountains, leaving nothing to the imagination when it comes to mind-blowing landscapes and stunning variety.

You’ll kick off your trip amongst the other worldly landscapes of the San Pedro de Atacama desert, where you’ll explore salt caves and watch the unparalleled beauty of an Atacama sunset. Then you’ll head down south to experience life in Chile’s vibrant capital, Santiago de Chile, and enjoy the ocean breezes in the seaside cities of Viña del Mar and Valparíso.

It’s the lake district next, where you’ll visit the beguiling Laguna Verde, hike over lava fields and don your hiking boots to work up a sweat in Vicente Pérez Rosales, Chile’s oldest National Park. Your final adventure will be had in the wilds of Patagonia, home to the dramatic Torres del Paine National Park, where you’ll hike though incredible scenery in one of South America’s most beautiful protected areas.

dayInfo.description: From Puerto Montt to Puerto Varas - Upon arrival in Puerto Montt, you will have a private transfer to Puerto Varas.

Puerto Varas - Osorno Volcano & Petrohue Falls - After breakfast, enjoy a drive to Ensenada, visiting the enchanting Laguna Verde, Spanish for “Green Lagoon,” at the foot of Osorno Volcano within Vicente Perez Rosales National Park before heading to the slopes of the towering Osorno. The conical Volcano, soaring steeply overhead, has an appearance resembling Mount Fuji outside Tokyo, Japan. Enjoy a short hike over lava fields to reach the spectacular views over Llanquihue Lake and the Chilean Lake region. Hike in the woods through Chile’s oldest National Park Vicente Pérez Rosales to the impressive Petrohue waterfalls with its beautiful crystal green waters and gaze at the famous Osorno volcano.

Puerto Varas - Day at leisure - Day at leisure to enjoy one of the many activities that Puerto Varas has to offer, like kayaking at the National Park, horseback riding through Lake Llanquihue or a Farm day tour at one of the beautiful local Estancias.

Puerto Varas / Punta Arenas / Torres del Paine National Park - At appropriate time you will be transferred to Puerto Montt airport to take your flight to Punta Arenas (private service). Upon arrival, a shuttle transfer will drive you to Torres del Paine National Park. Welcome to Southern Patagonia! Torres del Paine is one of the most beautiful protected areas of South America, and for sure the best way to explore it is by foot. If you like hiking and nature, this should be one of the highlights of your trip. From owls to deers, from condors to guanacos, from orchids to blueberries, with the back of the impressive granite massif, this magnificent place is breathtaking. Some of the trekking options include the full day to the base of the magnificent Torres del Paine, ideal for trekkers, the intense blue of the Grey Glaciar or the unforgettable view of the French Valley. Depending in which area of the Park you are staying, you will be able to explore different paths. We will provide you with complete trekking information of the park, so that you can decide the best plan to make the best of your day. ***Please check with our travel Advisor which are the best options from your hotel location.
Day 5 - Torres del Paine National Park - Today you can choose from the lodge tour list the tour you like most.
Torres del Paine National Park - Today you can choose from the lodge tour list the tour you like most.

Torres Del Paine / Santiago De Chile - At appropriate time shuttle transfer from Hosteria Las Torres to Punta Arenas Airport and catch your flight to Santiago. Arrival in Santiago late evening. This night you´ll stay at the Airport hotel, walking distance from the disembarking area.

Santiago de Chile / Calama / San Pedro De Atacama - In the morning you´ll take your flight to Calama. Upon arrival to Calama airport you will be transfered (shared service) to San Pedro de Atacama hotel. Welcome to San Pedro! San Pedro de Atacama is a small town in the driest desert of the world. Little adobe houses, cozy restaurants are the base to explore one of Chile’s most spectacular sceneries.

San Pedro De Atacama - The tour begins by visiting Chaxa lagoon, located in the northern sector of the Salar de Atacama, distant 62 km from the village. On the surface of the Salar can be observed salt crusts generated by the accumulation of crystals produced by the evaporation of saline groundwater. After visiting the Salar, we continue the journey to the Highland Lakes, Miñiques and Miscanti, this beautiful landscape is located 110 kms from San Pedro de Atacama, and 4,300 meters high. Once back, we visited Socaire village which was formerly important for its gold mines that were located near the border with Argentina. Currently is characterized by its typical atacamenian cuisine. Finally, we visited the village of Toconao, which is an oasis, which allow freshwater growing all kinds of fruits and vegetables. The village is built with stone liparite, soft volcanic stone, obtained from a quarry located near it. Bear in mind that today you will have breakfast during the tour.

San Pedro de Atacama - During the morning, experience one of the most astonishing phenomenon produced by nature, be impressed by contrasting colors produced by the steam columns in the highest Geothermal field in the world. Take the most amazing photographs walking across the tracks over the field. Have the unique opportunity to swim in the The Tatio spring waters, rich in minerals. Go along the imposing Andes mountain range, and participate in the adventure of observing native plants and animals in their natural habitat. After thsi experience, discover the unique forms of salt and clay in the “Three Marias” area. Visit the amazing geological shapes located in one of the world’s driest and most hostile zones of the world: the Atacama Desert. Appreciate the great molding power of the natural forces of our planet, be amazed with the delicate work of nature over thousands of years, contemplate and photograph incomparable sculptures. Enjoy an exciting experience in the Salt caves , surprising shapes in the middle of the salt mountain range. The highlight of your adventure will be waiting for the Atacama sunset, opening your senses to the wonderful landscapes and colors of the mountains, with the Licancabur Volcano as the age-old witness of a new evening in the desert.

San Pedro De Atacama / Santiago De Chile - At the appropriate time, you will be driven to Calama airport (about two hour away- shared service). Welcome to Santiago! Home of Pisco Sour, variety of seafood and marvelous Cavernet Sauvignon, Santiago is considerate as the safest city in South America- capital of Chile, the country of the extremes, it is the perfect base to explore the country, or just enjoy a few days between the mountains and the ocean. Upon arrival you will have a transfer to your hotel (private service).

Santiago De Chile - Full day Viña del Mar & Valparaiso Tour - Discover the quirky town of Valparaíso and stroll through bohemian neighborhoods that offer spectacular views over the Pacific Ocean. This picturesque city was declared World Heritage by UNESCO. Visit Viña Del Mar, known as The Garden City, a nice place to enjoy a short walk along the beach.
Santiago De Chile - Today you will have the day at leisure, to explore Santiago de Chile at your own pace.
Santiago de Chile - At appropriate time, you will be transferred to the airport (private service).

tourName: Chile holiday, 17 days south to north
placesVisited: Santiago, Punta Arenas, estancia visit, Torres del Paine National Park, Ancud, Chiloé Island homestay, Castro, Puerto Montt, Puerto Varas, Huilo Huilo biological reserve, Geométricas Hot Springs, Pucon, National Park of Huerquehue, options: climb Villarrica volcano, Trancura River Rafting, cycling, San Pedro de Atacama, Atacama Desert, Valley of the Moon hike, Tatio Geysers, Los Flamencos National Reserve, Valparaiso
generalInfo:
Chile is diverse, both ethnically and geographically, and its many natural wonders, amazing landscapes and warm people are not to be rushed. So this Chile holiday allows 17 days to journey from south to north, to fully appreciate this spectacular country. This is a self guided adventure, so you’ll be travelling independently, discovering Chile on your own terms. Transport is via a mix of private transfers, internal flights and self driving. Throughout, you are fully supported by a road book, which contains all the information you’ll need for the trip to run smoothly. We also provide a local SIM card, so you can contact us 24 hours a day and friendly hosts and homestay families will be waiting to welcome you at each destination. This trip is also tailor made, so it can be tweaked and adapted to suit your interests and needs.

The trip begins in Santiago, from where you fly south to properly begin this adventure. First, explore Chilean Patagonia, home to the breath-taking Torres del Paine National Park, with its towering peaks, impressive glaciers, fjords, blue lakes and deep forests. From here, pick up your rental car and drive through Chiloé Island, a place drenched in myths with many wooden churches, before exploring the Pacific Coast’s lush virgin forest. You’ll then have time to discover the volcanoes and lakes of the beautiful Lake District and your adventure ends in San Pedro de Atacama. This small village sits like an oasis in the Atacama Desert, with its lunar landscapes and huge starry skies.

Highlights of this memorable trip include the National Park of Huerquehue, which lies in the foothills of the Andes, the Huilo Huilo biological reserve in central Patagonian and the lagoons of the Los Flamencos National Reserve. Sunrise at the Tatio Geysers is spectacular, while the Moon Valley in the Atacama Desert glowing pink as the sun sets is really special. In addition you could spend a full day at an estancia, to experience “huaso” culture, hike to the summit of Villarrica volcano or enjoy a night in the wine region between Santiago and the Atlantic coast.

There are plenty of opportunities to meet local people and learn about their culture. At the estancia, help out with organic farming, and herding and milking the animals, while on Chiloé, spend a couple of nights staying with local small scale farmers and their families. It’s a really authentic way to find out more about local life and enjoy some home cooking, too.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Santiago by international flight. You are met at the airport by our driver and transferred to your hotel. Wander around the capital city with a member of our team, soaking up the atmosphere and visiting some interesting sites: Bellavista, a bohemian neighbourhood, Plaza de Armas with its colonial architecture and Cerro Santa Lucia with its scenic view over the city and the Andes. > Transport : private transfer - 45min > Accommodation: Aparthotel > Included meals : none

Flight Santiago de Chile > Punta Arenas. Your driver will pick you up in the morning to take you to the airport. Arrive in Punta Arenas by midday. Drive to Puerto Natales. This is a small town facing the Andes on the shores of Seno Ultima Esperanza, at the southern end of the Chilean Fjords. The rest of the day is yours to explore of the city. > Transport : car rental - 3 hours > Accommodation: Hotel > Included meals : none

Early departure for Torres Del Paine National Park. Along the way, you get to appreciate ñandus and guanacos in their natural environment. Settle in the hosteria. In the afternoon, a short self-guided hike. Optional: navigation to Grey glacier. > Transport : rental car - 2h > Accommodation : refuge > Included meals : Breakfast > Hiking : 4 - 5 hours easy hike

In the morning you could hike to Salto Grande (waterfall), with the eye-catching view of the huge Horns of Torres del Paine. Salto Grande is an impressive waterfall where the water drops more than 10 meters from the blue waters of Lake Nordenskjold into what eventually turns into Lake Pehoé. From the Salto Grande waterfall the trail continues to the picture-perfect Nordenskjöld Lake. > Transport : rental car > Accommodation : refuge > Included meals : Breakfast

Very early departure to hike to the famous towers. Take an impressive trail winding its way towards the famous vertical granite face, towering more than 1.000 meters and overlooking a small glacier mounted on a glacial lake. Return to your vehicle by mid-afternoon to make your way back to Punta Arenas where you will arrive in the evening. > Transport : rental car - 5h > Accommodation : hotel > Included meals : breakfast > Hiking : 8 h ; 900m change in altitude

Fly from Punta Arenas to Puerto Montt where you pick up your new rental car. Drive to the city of Castro, on Chiloe Island. This is a great opportunity to immerse yourself in the local culture. Your could stay overnight in a stilthouse or a Refugio just ourside Castro, ideal place for birdwatching.

A free day for you in Castro. We will recommend itinerary to visit the famous wooden churches of this magic island. . > Transportation: rental car – 170km – 3h > Accommodation: Stilthouse > Included meals: Breakfast

Time to leave the island. Return to Puerto Montt and from there to Puerot Varas. We highly recommend the spectacular waterfalls Saltos of Petrohue, at the foot of the imposing Volcano Osorno in the Andes Precordillera. Overnight in Puerto Varas. > Transport : rental car – 190 km - 4h > Accommodation : Hotel > Included meals : Breakfast

Travel to Huilo Huilo, a biological reserve in the middle of the Patagonian rainforest of Chile. A unique experience in harmony with nature. This is an natural reserve with incredible accomodation alternatives. You can enjoy the park’s facilities and hikes. This place is worth staying a few nights. Please consider crossing to Argentina's lake district, with a beautiful lake crossing. > Transport : rental car – 350 km - 4h30 > Accommodation : Hotel > Included meals : Breakfast > Activities are not included

On your way to Pucon, pass by the Geométricas Hot Springs, the result of an ambitious project by an architect in harmony with nature; a good choice for some fabulous relaxing time. By late afternoon you will reach Pucon, a beautiful little village nestled at the base of a volcano along the shores of Lake Villarrica. > Transport : rental car – 164km - 3h > Accommodation : Hotel > Included meals : Breakfast > Entrance to the Hot Springs not included

We recommend you to visit the National Park of Huerquehue, located near the town of Pucon. Soak up the special atmosphere of an ancient Araucaria forest; appreciate these stunning trees commonly known as “monkey puzzle” and three splendid lagoons. The hike is not very difficult but it takes between 2 to 3 hour climbing before reaching the lagoons. Araucarias are sacred trees to the Mapuche who harvest and use its "piñones" or seeds in the preparation of various traditional dishes. There are som many interesting activities in the area. You could considere climbing Villarrica volcano 8 to 9 hour hike. > Transportation: rental car – 50 km - 1h20min > Accommodation: lodge > Included meals: breakfast > Hiking: 4 to 5 hours easy walk, 400m change in altitude

Flight Temuco > Santiago de Chile > Calama. Depart early in the morning for Villarica’s airport where you return your rental car. You will fly north to south so watch out for the change in temperature. Once in Calama, you will be in the heart of the driest desert in the world, the Atacama Desert. On arrival a van will be waiting to take you directly to your hotel in San Pedro de Atacama where you will arrive at the end of the day. > Transport : rental car 130 km - 1h45min + minibus 2h > Accommodation: Hotel > Included meals : breakfast

Free morning to visit the town of San Pedro de Atacama. Discover the Ayllus village area, composed of several communities (or oasis) around San Pedro de Atacama. We recommend you to visit the museum Le Paige, an opportunity to learn about the culture of the Atacama people. In the afternoon venture in the Valley of the Moon, hike to the salt caves Las Tres Marias. Sunset on the salt mountain range before heading back to your hotel! > Transport : van - 1h30min > Accommodation: Hotel > Included meals : Breakfast

Very early departure to reach the Tatio Geysers before sunrise. An impressive show will then gradually unfold, the temperature of the air will fall, and the water vapour will start spurting out several meters above the ground. Return to San Pedro de Atacama and pass through the small village of Machuca where you can appreciate the traditional architecture of a high altitude village, together with its fauna and flora. Return to San Pedro de Atacama in the afternoon. > Transport : van - 5h > Accommodation: Hotel > Included meals : breakfast

Explore the beautiful lagoons of Miscanti and Miñiques, part of the Los Flamencos National Reserve. Located at an elevation of 4200 m above sea level, these lagoons sit at the base of the two volcanos and were separated from each other by a lava flow from an eruption. Enjoy the stunning views of this breeding ground for flamingos. > Transport : van - 5h > Accommodation: Hotel > Included meals : breakfast

Flight Calama > Santiago de Chile. Free morning in San Pedro de Atacama then around midday a van will take you from your hotel directly to Calama’s airport. Arrive in Santiago by late afternoon and drive to Valparaiso by private transfer. > Transport : private transfer - 1h45 > Accommodation: Bed & Breakfast > Included meals : breakfast
Final day in Chile. Your driver will pick you up at your hotel and take you to the airport 3 hours before departure of your flight. > Transportation: private transfer– 45m > Included meals: Breakfast

tourName: Chile luxury tailor made holiday
generalInfo:
Take in Chile's dramatic landscapes and discover it's fascinating cultures on this leisurely paced yet epic private three-week adventure.

Starting in the vibrant cities of Santiago and Valparaiso, travel over 1500km by road with your private driver as far as fascinating Chiloe Island, via the charming winelands and lush Lake District. Following a fully immersive extended stay amongst the mind-blowing landscapes of the Atacama Desert, finish the trip with a spot of relaxation at our favourite boutique vineyard.

All of our trips can be tailormade from scratch, so take this as an example of what is possible and "Enquire Now" so we can create your very own dream adventure.

dayInfo.description: SANTIAGO: Welcome to Chile! Your time in the capital includes a gastronomic tour of the city's market district, and an exploration of it's emblematic Barrios (neighbourhoods) to enjoy the street art and vibrant modern culture that keeps Santiago buzzing.

VINEYARDS & VALPARAISO - Depart Santiago for a visit to a renowned winery in the charming Casablanca Valley, before continuing to the vibrant coastal city of Valparaiso. Here you will be taken on a fun-filled "live like a local" city tour by foot and public transport, to see the city from the eyes of it's residents.

COLCHAGUA VALLEY - After being driven down to Santa Cruz in the wine-growing heartland of the country, the following day you will enjoy a private full day wine-tasting tour at two leading vineyards (lunch included of course!)

PUCON - Starting with a long drive south into the Lake District (8 hours, or you may choose to fly), the next day we are invited to spend time at a working indigenous farm to learn about the Mapuche culture, try their fresh local cuisine, and hike or try horseback riding. We also have time to marvel at the famous snow-capped volcano, and relax amongst the local scenery.

HUILO HUILO - This beautiful nature reserve is one of Chile's hidden secrets, and we'll spend two wonderful days here. Hiking paths lead from the hotel through temperate rainforest to the Huilo Huilo waterfalls, whilst we can also enjoy horse-riding, canopy tours, kayaking, and dawn or sunset jeep rides to the Choshuenco volcano.

PUERTO VARAS & CHILOE - Continuing our journey south, we reach Puerto Varas on the shores of Lake Llanquihue, from where we will visit the many waterfalls, forests, rivers, and volcanoes of the area. Whilst here we will also explore fascinating Chiloe Island on a full day cultural tour, including a chance to enjoy a traditional "curanto" meal.

ATACAMA - One of Latin America's most stunning landscapes, we think the Atacama deserves anything from 5-10 nights, such is the variety of breathtaking sights and experiences on offer. From the steaming El Tatio Geysers at dawn to sunsets over Moon Valley, via blinding salt flats, coloured lagoons, hot springs, even flamingos and llama farms. Hike, bike, or take a hot air balloon. This is a very special place indeed.

CASABLANCA - Return to Santiago and either fly home, or extend your time with a relaxing couple of days at a charming vineyard less than 2 hours drive away from the airport... the perfect way to end your Chilean odyssey.

tourName: Chile multi activity holiday
generalInfo:
Designed for the active traveller, this two-week adventure immerses you in the heart of Chile’s wilderness. Hike volcanoes, white-water raft rapids, trek forested valleys, and kayak across majestic lakes: all in one extraordinary adventure.

Arrive in Santiago, Chile’s vibrant capital and directly head to the surrounding countryside to explore Chile’s boutique winelands. Hike, cycle or horse ride, and sample the country’s world-class wines.

Fly south to the pristine landscapes of Chile’s Lake District, dividing your time between Pucon and Puerto Varas. Explore Villarrica National Park, climb its volcano and hike through forests filled with ancient Araucaria trees. Marvel at the snow-capped Osorno Volcano before continuing south to Torres del Paine National Park for an all-inclusive stay at one of our favourite lodges. Located inside the park and within a private reserve, hike unexplored paths, kayak or swim in Toro Lake, or simply admire the amazing scenery that surrounds the lodge.

Excursions are a mix of private and small-group tours, led by expert local guides. Accommodation has been hand-picked by us to ensure a comfortable and enriching experience. This trip can be tailored to your interests, so let us know your preferences.

dayInfo.description: Winelands: Arrive in Santiago, Chile’s vibrant capital, and directly transfer to the surrounding countryside to explore Chile's boutique winelands. Cycle through the country’s world-class vineyards with your local guide and enjoy a picnic lunch in a stunning setting. Sample wine from the region and indulge in fresh produce from local artisans.

Pucon: Fly to Chile’s adventure capital. This lively lakeside town is a hub for outdoor adventures. From hiking, kayaking and rafting or relaxing in nearby hot springs, Pucon is a great base to explore some of Chile’s striking scenery. During your stay, hike to the top of Villarrica Volcano with a local expert guide and be rewarded with stunning views at the top of one of Chile’s most active volcanoes. Head to the Trancura River for an unforgettable white-water adventure. Navigate thrilling river rapids as you journey through dramatic ravines and valleys, surrounded by wild scenery.

Puerto Varas: Transfer by road to charming town Puerto Varas, known for its lakes and German colonial influences. During your stay, immerse yourself in the traditions of the Mapuche Huilliche, the ancestral people of Southern Chile. This cultural tour offers an authentic insight to their history, customs, and way of life, providing a meaningful connection with the local community.

Torres del Paine: Journey deeper into Patagonia and fly to the charming port town of Puerto Natales and continue to Torres del Paine National Park. Spend four nights at a remarkable lodge exploring the best of the park. Hike the French Valley with its glaciers and towering granite walls, kayak the pristine waters of Lago Toro, or trek to the iconic Base of Towers. All guided excursions are included as part of your stay and will allow you to explore all four corners of this legendary national park.

Santiago: Say goodbye to Patagonia and fly north to Santiago, where you’ll spend one final night before heading home. If you would like to make the most of your time in the capital, we can arrange a guided city tour or recommend some wonderful places to eat- just let us know your preferences.

tourName: Chile skiing holiday
generalInfo:
On this 7-day itinerary, you'll enjoy a private tour of Santiago's historic centre, the famous port town of Valparaíso, and an organic vineyard with some of the best grapes in the world. Finally, you will head to one of the best ski centres in the Andes to enjoy an all-inclusive service as you hit the slopes!

Ski season in Chile is July-September although this can vary slightly season to season. The resort has a ski school for adults and children for skiing and snowboarding and also offers guided ski tours around the nearby mountains. The resort also welcomes people with physical or mental disabilities for adapted skiing.

Short itinerary:
Day 1: Airport – Santiago / Private “City Tour”.
Day 2: Santiago – Private Tour “Valparaiso & Wine”.
Day 3 to 6: Santiago – Portillo Ski Center.
Day 7: Portillo Ski Center – Santiago.

Included:
- 2 nights at the Eco Boutique Hotel Bidasoa - Breakfast only. Food samples provided on day 1.
- 4 nights at the Portillo Ski Center - All inclusive.
- All transfers and activities mentioned in the itinerary.
- Unlimited access to rope bridges, heated pool, sauna, jacuzzi, weights room, gym, and yoga classes, cinema, games room, activities for kids, young people and adults, nightclub, piano bar, ski and boot lockers at Portillo Ski Center.

Not included:
- Any meals not specified in the itinerary
- Travel insurance
- International flights and airport taxes

dayInfo.description: SANTIAGO PRIVATE CITY TOUR - When you arrive at Santiago airport, a private van will be waiting to take you to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time, once you’re settled into the hotel we’ll begin a City Tour of Santiago at 2 pm approx. We’ll visit various places of significance such as the seat of the government, the multicultural square Plaza de Armas, the picturesque Central and la Vega Market, the San Cristobal Hill and some historic areas including Lastarria, Bellas Artes, and Santiago Centro. Finally, you will be taken back to your accommodation.

VALPARAISO & WINES - PRIVATE TOUR - On day 2 you'll head to the coast to explore the historic port town and UNESCO World Heritage Site of Valparaíso. Try one of the local trolleybuses or elevators to climb the hills. Here you can also enjoy the street art that makes the city famous as well as the views of the hills, port and ocean. After lunch, you'll return inland to the vines of the Casablanca Valley, world-renowned for its wine production. We'll stop off at the Emiliana vineyard (or similar) for a tour around ts incredible organic vines, where we’ll have the opportunity to sample several types of grape along with locally-produced cheese or chocolate. finally we will return to Santiago.

PORTILLO SKI CENTER - After breakfast at your hotel in Santiago, a van will be waiting to take you to the Portillo Ski Center, located in the Andes province. The center is considered to be an excellent skiing destination due to its first-class facilities and services. It has 14 rope bridges, 35 pistes and 500 hectares of land, making it an unmissable destination for lovers of skiing! At the centre, you will be able to enjoy 4 nights and 5 days of an all-inclusive programme, including 4 daily meals (breakfast, lunch, tea and supper), unlimited access to the rope bridges and all the resort’s facilities such as heated swimming pool, saunas, jacuzzis, yoga classes and more. You will enjoy both sport and relaxation activities.
AIRPORT TRANSFER - On the final day, your transfer will pick you up from the ski centre to take you to the airport. We hope you enjoyed your trip!

tourName: Chilean Fjords small ship cruise, Kaweskar Route
generalInfo:
Join a 4-night, 5-day sea voyage to the Southern Patagonian Ice Field following the Kaweskar route, sailing 505 miles to visit the largest number of glaciers in this region: Guilliard, Amalia, El Brujo (the Warlock), and the glaciers of Calvo, and Montanas fjords.

We will visit some 15 glaciers where we will offer activities such as sightseeing, walks to the glacier front and moraines, and navigating between coloured icebergs in expedition boats such as Capitán Constantino (Captain Constantine). We will also keep an eye out for the varied flora and fauna of Patagonia, still in a wild and virgin state, such as the elephant seals in the Guardramiro fjord, condors, dolphins, sea lions and penguins.

Sett sail aboard the MS Skorpios III from mid October to mid April from the Skorpios Terminal in the city of Puerto Natales, located 2,500 km south of Santiago, which can be accessed by air from Punta Arenas or by land from Argentina.

dayInfo.description: Embarkation and Caleta Juarez Day 1: Embarkation 09:30 - 11:00. Departure from Skorpios terminal at 1300. Ship safety talk at 14:00. Lunch. Navigation in the Almirante Montt Gulf. 16:30. Arrival at Caleta Juarez in Guardramiro Fjord and disembark on boats to see up close a colony of elephant seals. 1800. Departure, crossing Kirke narrows, Morla Vicuna, Union, Collingwood, and Sarmiento channels. NB Important: On April 2026 the departures are going to be at 12:00pm and the boarding time at 11:00am and the start of boarding is at 08:30 - 10:00am, due to the official time change in Chile.

Fjords and glaciers Sailing north through Pitt Channel. Chatam Island is visible on the port side. 08:45 Entry into Guillard Fjord. Sailing through the interior of the fjord to Guillard Glacier. Disembark at the glacier and hike around the area, depending on tidal conditions. 11:30 a.m. Set sail south. Arriving at Amalia Glacier, boat rides in the bay of this wonderful place. Conditions permitting, we will disembark, as this glacier is constantly moving and has altered its beach and surroundings.

Fjords and glaciers Arriving at El Brujo Glacier. Weather and ice conditions permitting, you can descend to admire this glacier from a nearby rock. You will then set sail for the spectacular Calvo Fjord. At Calvo Fjord, you will take an excursion on a boat which suitable for sailing among the ice, called the Captain Constantine, visiting the Fernando, Captain Constantine, and Alipio glaciers, among others. Set sail for the Mountains Fjord.

Exploration, hiking and farewell dinner Today you will visit to the Fjord of the Mountains, where you can observe four glaciers descending from the Sarmiento Mountain Range to the sea, two of which are included in our logbook. Visit to the Alsina Glacier, disembarkation on exploration boats to explore this small bay and appreciate the beauty of this glacier and the enormous mountains that surround it. After returning to the boat, and continue sailing through the Fjord of the Mountains toward the Bernal Glacier where you will disembark. We begin a hike through a small native forest and along a trail that crosses a small lagoon of glacial water. We continue the hike over the frontal and lateral moraines until we reach the front of the glacier. From here, we will have the opportunity to touch some ice and witness the retreat of a glacier that no longer reaches the sea. Whilst you do this the ship is being replenished with pure, natural water from a waterfall, this water is consumed on board for all ship services. We set sail through the Fjord of the Mountains, where we will see the Herman and Zamudio glaciers. Cross the Angostura White. This evening you will have a farewell party, Captain's dinner, and dancing. Sailing through the Gulf of Almirante Montt.
Disembark Puerto Natales Arrival in Puerto Natales. Depending on wind conditions, you will dock at the Skorpios Terminal in Puerto Natales by 07:00 with disembarkation between 0800 and 0930.

tourName: Chilean Patagonia holiday, tailor made
generalInfo:
In just under three weeks journey into the rugged wilderness of Chile, exploring remote natural gems and visiting four of the country’s most iconic national parks.

Begin and end in Santiago, Chile’s capital, before heading south to the Aysen region. Navigate the Marble caves, explore the rugged beauty of Patagonia National Park, and marvel at the mighty San Rafael Glacier. Continue to the Lake District and Chiloè Island, where you’ll discover colourful stilt houses, UNESCO-listed wooden churches and immerse yourself in local traditions during a home-cooked lunch with a Chiloè family. End your wild exploration of Chile in Torres del Paine National Park, seeking out the elusive puma, and enjoying guided activities that showcase both the pristine Patagonian landscapes and local culture.

Excursions are a mix of private and small-group tours, led by expert local guides. Accommodation has been hand-picked by us to ensure a comfortable and enriching experience. This trip can be tailored to your interests, so let us know your preferences.

dayInfo.description: Santiago: Welcome to Chile’s capital Santiago. Upon arrival, settle into your boutique hotel in the heart of the city’s downtown. Spend the afternoon at leisure or let us organise a city tour or culinary experience on request.

Coyhaique: Return to Santiago airport and fly south to Coyhaique: the capital of the Aysen region and gateway to remote and untouched Patagonia. Spend two nights in the city in a rustic, charming hotel. The following day, with your expert local guide explore the trails of Cerro Castillo National Park. See hanging glaciers, hike through native forest and enjoy a true Patagonian experience on this full day tour.

The Aysen Region: This morning, with your expert guide visit the Marble Caves, accessible only by boat. Navigate through the striking marble formations and marvel at their swirling blue and turquoise reflections. Continue along the shores of General Carrera Lake, Chile’s second largest lake, where you’ll be welcomed into a charming family-run lodge that will be your home for the next four nights. Over the coming days, discover the highlights of the Aysen region at your own leisure. From the secluded San Rafael Lagoon and its glacier, Patagonia National Park and the rapids of the Baker River, immerse yourself in the wild beauty of Chilean Patagonia.

Puerto Varas: Fly to Chile’s Lake District and transfer by road to the charming town of Puerto Varas, known for its lakes and German colonial influences. Stay one night at a lakeside hotel overlooking Lake Llanquihue and Osorno Volcano.

Chiloè: Take a morning ferry crossing to the enchanted island of Chiloè: a place of myths, traditions and wild beauty. Over the next three nights, get-off-the beaten path with your expert guide and visit the island’s coastal wetlands, villages and heritage church. Join a local family and learn what life was like for the ancient Chiloè farmer and learn all about the local traditions that have been preserved to this day. Take part in a unique gastronomical experience with a renowned chef and explore the bustling local market which offers an authentic experience into rural life on the island.

Torres del Paine: Journey deeper into Patagonia and fly to the colourful port town of Puerto Natales and continue to Torres del Paine National Park. Spend four nights at a charming working estancia where Patagonian heritage, conservation efforts and outdoor adventure are all part of the experience. Horseback ride across the Patagonian steppe, join conservation safaris to observe and learn about the local wildlife and conservation efforts, hike to spectacular viewpoints and discover the history of the estancia through cultural tours. All guided excursions are included as part of your stay and will allow you to explore the stunning landscapes and heritage of the park.

tourName: Easter Island to Atacama holiday in Chile
generalInfo:
From the ancient archaeological wonders of Easter Island to the Martian landscapes of a sky-scraping desert, our “Easter Island to Atacama: Culture and Nature” tour will immerse you in the natural wonders and cultural diversity of our unique country. We’ll start our journey on Easter Island, a tiny, remote speck of land in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. This island has been home to the Rapa Nui people for thousands of years, who crafted the giant rock “Moai” statues that dot the island’s landscapes. We’ll explore those ancient archaeological sites, learn about local culture and traditions, and discover the treasures of this Polynesian gem. Returning to the mainland, we’ll then explore the highlights of Central Chile, like the capital city of Santiago, the colorful port of Valparaiso, and the idyllic wine valleys. The trip ends in the Atacama Desert, the driest desert in the world, where we’ll discover otherworldly landscapes like steaming-hot geyser fields, timeless lunar valleys, highland lagoons, hazy mountains and volcanoes, and some of the most spectacular night skies on the planet.

Day 2: Easter Island - Arrival

Day 4: Easter Island - Moai Statues

Day 7: Santiago - Valparaíso and Casablanca Wine Valley
Day 8: Santiago to Calama - Leisure Day in San Pedro de Atacama
Day 9: San Pedro de Atacama - Altiplanic Lagoons
Day 10: San Pedro de Atacama - Tatio Geysers & Machuca Village
