dayInfo.description: SANTIAGO – HALF-DAY “BITE OF SANTIAGO” CITY TOUR – Welcome to Chile! A representative from our company will meet you at the Santiago International Airport to welcome you upon arrival. During the drive to your hotel, our representative will tell you more about your upcoming itinerary, as well as answer any questions you may have. During the afternoon, you’ll head out on a tour of the city where you’ll learn about Chilean history and culture by visiting the city center and other important monuments, as well as getting a taste for the local cuisine by visiting food markets and stalls to try traditional dishes, learn about their preparation, and meet locals. At the end of the day, you’ll have become an honorary Santiaguino, which is what the locals are called! Afterward the tour, you’ll have free time to get dinner and then return to your hotel at your leisure.

SANTIAGO DE CHILE – PUERTO MONTT – PUERTO VARAS – At a pre-arranged time, we’ll pick you up from your hotel in Santiago to take you to the airport for your flight to Puerto Montt. Once you arrive, a representative will be waiting to welcome you and drive you to the Lahuen Ñadi Natural Reserve, a small park in the Lake District. Type: Private Tour Known as the “Gateway to Patagonia,” the Lakes District boasts of some of Chile’s most spectacular but undiscovered natural wonders, as well as an incredible biodiversity of plant and wildlife. During our stay here, we’ll be using the town of Puerto Varas as our base camp; located on the shores of Llanquihue Lake and with two volcanoes on the horizon, Puerto Varas is a unique microcosm of Germanic culture here in the Lakes District. In the 1800s, large numbers of Germans emigrated here, taking over native lands, and bringing their architecture, food, and traditions with them. Puerto Varas is home to some of the best-preserved examples of Germanic houses in the region. On this first day, after flying from Santiago to Puerto Montt, we’ll head to a nearby natural reserve for an easy hike to introduce you to the flora and fauna of southern Chile, guided by a professional naturalist. On the way, we’ll pass the scenic River Maulli´n before reaching the reserve, which protects some of the region’s threatened temperate rainforests as well as one of the last patches of native Alerce trees in the area. The temperate rainforests here are some of the most precious gems of the Lakes District, full of unique plants and animals that you can keep an eye out for during our walk. During the short hike, we’ll learn about and observe the rich diversity of mosses, lichens, fungi, climbing vines, ferns and trees with the use of magnifying glasses, as well as local birds and other wildlife. We’ll then head to Puerto Varas for the evening.

PUERTO VARAS - Full Day Tour: Chiloé Penguins and Culture – We’ll pick you up from your hotel in the morning to head to the main island of Chiloe´, located in an archipelago of the same name. Accessible from the mainland only by ferry, this string of islands is one of the most fascinating places in the Lakes District, home to a distinct culture and way of life, incredible plant and wildlife, and magical tales about ghost ships, mermaids, and warlocks. Crossing over onto the main island, we’ll head to a penguin colony at Pun~ihuil, where we’ll be able to observe Humboldt and Magellanic penguins. We’ll then explore local communities and towns to learn more about these islands. The Chilote people are extremely welcoming and open, so we’ll have chances to meet and chat with locals for a more immersive, authentic experience. We’ll then return to the mainland and head back to Puerto Varas for the evening. Activities: - Trip to Pun~ihuil Penguin Colony - Fauna Observation - Flora, Fauna & Geology Interpretation - Cultural Immersion - Meeting With Locals

PUERTO VARAS - Full Day Tour: Two Volcanoes Hike – Ready to hike on a volcano today? Well, not just one volcano: two volcanoes! Today, we’ll spend the day hiking among the foothills of two of Chile’s most active and beautiful volcanoes, both located near Puerto Varas. In the morning, you’ll be fetched from your hotel by your naturalist guide, who will take you to the site of the first hike on Calbuco Volcano. This 2.5 hour, roughly two-and-a-half mile hike will pass through landscapes that have seen recent eruptions and are covered in black lava and basaltic rock formations, as well as the temperate rainforests that encircle the base of the volcano. During the hike, the guide will tell you all about the geology of the volcano and landscapes, pointing out how local flora and fauna has adapted to live in such a harsh, unpredictable environment. After finishing this hike, we’ll head to the trailhead for our next hike, with a break along the way for lunch. This second hike heads along the Osorno Volcano, heading about 3.5 miles along the base of the volcano with unparalleled views of the cone and the surrounding area which consists of lava flows, forests, and lakes. The hike will last between 3-4 hours, depending on how fast the group is and with pauses to learn about the flora and fauna, before returning to Puerto Varas for a relaxing evening. Activities: - Wildlife Observation - Photography - Hiking - Geological and naturalist interpretation

PUERTO VARAS – PUERTO MONTT – PUNTA ARENAS – Half Day Tour: A Day in Huilliche Territory – Punta Arenas – Today in the morning, you’ll start the day heading to a little-explored wilderness area for an easy 1.5 hour hike through a quiet part of the rainforest, looking for local wildlife and enjoying the serenity and calming views of this hidden part of the world. You’ll then be taken to Pargua, where you’ll get a chance to learn about one of the indigenous groups that calls the Lakes District home: the Huilliche. The Huilliche are one of several groups for whom this region is an ancestral home, but colonizers and settlers have taken their lands and eroded their cultural, political, and societal influence here, but these groups still exist and practice their unique cultures. At this traditional Huilliche village, you’ll get to learn about their way of life, history, cuisine, medicine, and more, to gain a more nuanced understanding of the history of the Lakes District. In the afternoon, you’ll be taken to the airport for your flight to Punta Arenas, one of the southernmost cities in the world. Once you arrive, a representative will be waiting to welcome you and will drive you approx. 45 minutes to your hotel in town for the night. Dinner is at your leisure, but we have plenty of great recommendations!

MAGDALENA ISLAND – PUERTO NATALES – In the morning, you’ll get to experience one of the most exciting parts of living in Patagonia: the amazing wildlife. You’ll hop on a boat tour that will head to Magdalena Island, a protected nature reserve that is home to thousands of Magellanic penguins! The island is a breeding ground for them, and your guide will tell you all about this species as you follow the marked paths through the colony, heading toward a scenic lighthouse where you’ll be told more about the island’s ecosystem. After arriving back in Punta Arenas, you’ll swing by the hotel to pick up your things and will then be transferred to Puerto Natales. It’s about a 3 hour drive. Along the way, you’ll pass beautiful landscapes and maybe even see some local wildlife, so the time will fly by. We’ll also pause periodically to stretch our legs and use the bathroom. When we arrive in Puerto Natales, you’ll be taken to your hotel for dinner and a relaxing evening before tomorrow’s big hike. Note on Penguin Watching Excursion: In Patagonia, the weather conditions can change quickly, and unruly weather is common, so there may be times that the boat tour is not available due to bad weather and unsafe conditions. In the event of this, an alternative program will be arranged.

TORRES DEL PAINE – Full Day Hike: Base de Torres – After a hearty breakfast, we’ll head out early to take on Torres del Paine’s most iconic hike: the Base de Torres or Base of the Towers hike! Departing from the trailhead, the trail ascends upwards from the outside of the massif of mountains toward the Ascencio Valley; along the way, be sure to pause and look around to take in the spectacular scenery. After reaching the entry point to the valley, the trail descends into the forest along the valley floor, heading to the El Chileno Campsite and Refugio. From there, the trail continues through an ancient forest of lenga trees until it reaches the base of a steep glacial moraine, which we must climb up. It’s the most difficult part of the trail, but well worth it because at the top, you get the ultimate reward: the famous view of the dramatic Torres: the trio of granite spires for which the park is named, rising above a blue glacial lake. We’ll pause here a while to rest, enjoy lunch, and soak up the view before retracing our steps back to the trailhead. From there, we’ll drive back to the hotel for a well-deserved rest.

TORRES DEL PAINE – Full Day Hike: French Valley – The French Valley is one of the three main highlights of the “W” Trek -- the famous circuit that navigates the mountains of Torres del Paine in a w-shaped path -- and it is one of the most striking places along the route. The day begins at Pudeto Dock on the far side of the vibrant Lake Pehoe, where we will take a catamaran across the lake to the Paine Grande ranger station, campsite, and refugio at the base of Cerro Paine Grande. The sight of the mountains looming overhead is astonishing. Upon arriving at Paine Grande, we’ll start the hike up toward the mountains and the Italian Refugio and Campsite, skirting the edge of the massif. Along the way, we’ll encounter shimmering lakes, forests, and rolling grasslands. Upon reaching the campsite, we’ll hike upwards into the mountains to the entry point of the French Valley called the French Lookout, where you’ll be treated to amazing views of the surrounding mountains, lakes, and a hanging glacier that regularly calves parts of the glacier down the mountain walls. After a pause for lunch and to soak up the scenery, we’ll retrace our steps back to the catamaran, recross the lake, and return to the hotel for the evening.

PUERTO NATALES – Full Day Tour: Estancia La Peninsula – Back before it was a major tourist destination, a different kind of flock took over the Patagonian plains: sheep! This region was first colonized by sheep farmers, who bought up massive tracts of land to create estancias, also known as ranches. Today, we’ll visit one of these historic ranches to learn about its history and culture, as well as how it’s making moves to turn sheep farming in Patagonia into a more sustainable enterprise. Estancia La Peninsula is located on a remote peninsula that’s a 30-minute boat ride up into the fjords from Puerto Natales, the gateway town to Torres del Paine. After leaving the hotel in the morning to head to the dock, we’ll get to enjoy the scenic boat ride, and you can also sometimes see native wildlife. Arriving at the estancia, we’ll spend the full day immersing ourselves in the estancia lifestyle through activities and educational demonstrations. You’ll have the choice of either going on a horseback ride, hike, or 4-Wheel drive to explore the property, which has amazing views of the fjords and is a sanctuary for local birds and other wildlife. Returning to the ranch house, you’ll also get to observe sheep-shearing and sheepdog demonstrations, tour the estancia facilities, and eat a traditional Patagonian lamb barbecue known as “asado al palo” which is enjoyed with other side dishes and Chilean wine. At the end of the day, we’ll take the boat back to Puerto Natales and return to your hotel for the night.

PUERTO NATALES – Half Day Tour: Kayaking in Eberhard Fjord – Today you’ll get to appreciate the rugged spectacle of Patagonia’s wild fjords from a wholly unique perspective: a kayak! We’ll head to the town of Puerto Prat, roughly a 30-minute drive from Puerto Natales, where we’ll be greeted by our hosts who operate the kayaking business. These kind people open their homes to us and tell us about their lives in remote Patagonia; their house dates from 1909 and several generations have lived there. We’ll then receive our gear, listen to the safety lecture, and then head out onto the waters! The exact route is subject to change due to weather and water conditions, but overall the excursion will navigate along the historic Eberhard Fjord, from Puerto Prat to Puerto Consuelo, passing by Kruger Island (Island of the Dead). In addition to spectacular landscapes, also be sure to keep your eyes peeled for local wildlife like birds. During the excursion, we’ll pause on a remote shore to take a 40-minute walk to visit some amazing viewpoints. We’ll then jump back into our kayaks and return to Puerto Prat to enjoy a tasty local meal consisting of fresh bread, homemade jams made from native berries (calafate, currant, raspberry, rhubarb or rosehip), butter, scrambled eggs, coffee, tea, and milk. After eating, we’ll head back to Puerto Natales for the night. ? Location: Eberhard Fjord, Puerto Prat, Puerto Natales. ? Level of difficulty: Medium ? Duration: Approx. 6 hours.

PUERTO NATALES – PUNTA ARENAS – SANTIAGO DE CHILE – At a pre-arranged time, you’ll be picked up from your hotel in Puerto Natales for a three hour drive to the airport in Punta Arenas. After arriving in Santiago and getting settled at the hotel, you’ll have the chance to explore Santiago on your own and get dinner.

SANTIAGO DE CHILE - It’s the final day! Depending on when your flight is, you may have spare time during the day to visit some more of Santiago’s best points of interest. Below are a few suggestions, and we are available to help book/arrange any of these if you like. Then, at a prearranged time, you’ll be picked up from your hotel and taken to the airport for your departure flight. Safe travels! 1. Walk to the top of Cerro Santa Lucia 2. Take the cable-car tramway to the summit of Cerro San Cristobal 3. Visit local museums: . Museum of Memory and Human Rights. - National Museum of Natural History. - Chilean Museum of Pre-Columbian Arts. - Museum of Visual Arts. - Archaeological Museum of Santiago. 4. Visit Pablo Neruda's home museum. 5. Visit the Arts & Crafts village at Pueblito los Dominicos. 6. Dine at some of the top restaurants in Santiago.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Stargazing Tour
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at the airport in San Pedro de Atacama, and your private driver will greet and transfer you to your ecolodge and spa accommodation. Once you have had time to settle in, your guide will lead you through the charming town of San Pedro de Atacama and offer details into the history and culture of this unique town. Your guide can also provide you with an excellent dining recommendation so that you can enjoy your first Chilean meal. Once the sun has fully set, you will embark on a stargazing tour in the heart of the desert.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Sandboarding in the Desert
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will start with a transfer to the Atacama’s sand dunes. Here, you will have the opportunity to partake in Chile’s newly popularized sandboarding. From your sandboarding excursion, you can then indulge in a bike ride through some of the Atacama’s most notable sites. As you bike through the landscape, you will be guided to a shaded clearing and lunch that has been laid out just for you. After your bike tour, you will have some time to spend at your leisure before touring Atacama’s Moon Valley.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Discover the City
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will transfer to Santiago. Upon your arrival in the nation’s capital city, your driver will greet and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation in one of the city’s most charming neighborhoods. When you are ready, your guide will lead you on a tour of Santiago’s top sites and neighborhoods, beginning with the trendy neighborhood of Bellavista. Your tour will also lead you to La Chascona, which is the previous home of Pablo Neruda. Here, you can take a private tour of the home-turned-museum and discover the fascinating details of Pablo Neruda’s life and work.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Cerro San Cristobal
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will begin the day with a funicular ride to the top of Cerro San Cristobal. At the peak of the hill, you can visit the iconic statue of the Virgin Mary that towers over the city. At the park, you will have a few hours to spend at your leisure before descending to the Chilean Museum of Pre-Columbian Art. You will be guided on a private tour of the museum. Afterward, you will have the rest of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Valparaiso and Viña del Mar
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will lead you on a full-day excursion to the city of Valparaiso and the beach town of Viña del Mar. Upon arriving in this UNESCO World Heritage Site of Valparaiso, your guide will lead you on a tour of Plaza Sotomayor. After your tour, you can ride the funicular to the top of Cerro Alegre for views of the Pacific Ocean. When you are ready, you will transfer to Viña del Mar. Soon after, you will arrive in the seaside town of Viña del Mar, where you will enjoy a short guided tour of the city’s top sites. You will have the rest of the afternoon to relax at the beach and town.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Chile’s Top Wineries
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will transfer to the Maipo Valley. After a quick ride, you will arrive at your luxurious accommodation in the heart of Chile’s wine region. Once you have properly settled in, your guide will lead you on an exploration of the area. Your tour will begin with a private walk-through of the Maipo Valley’s top wineries. Here, you will even meet the local vintners and learn about their winemaking process. In the afternoon, you will have a customized wine tasting of the wineries’ top wines. Once your tasting concludes, you will have the rest of the afternoon to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Hot Springs and Scenic Trek
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will embark on a scenic trek through the Maipo Valley. During your excursion, our guide will point out the regional flora and fauna that you encounter. At the conclusion of your trek, you will transfer to natural hot springs. You can spend the afternoon here, relaxing in the hot springs and admiring phenomenal views of the surrounding landscape. When you are ready, you will leave the hot springs and return to the charming town to enjoy a wonderful banquet of fine regional wines and cheeses. The remainder of the evening will be at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Hike through Patagonia
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to Patagonia. When you arrive at the airport city of Punta Arenas, your driver will greet and transfer you to your accommodation in Torres del Paine National Park. Upon your arrival, you will be given some time to settle in and to appreciate the natural landscape of Patagonia. When you are ready, your guide will lead you on a customized tour through the park. Based on your skill level, you may choose a leisurely hike to the Mirador Cuernos viewpoint or opt for the more difficult trek, such as hiking to the Mirador Los Torres viewpoint.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Glamping under the Stars
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will visit several of the park’s incredible viewpoints. Although the journey is enough to take your breath away, you will be left completely mesmerized by the sheer beauty of Patagonia when you arrive at your final viewpoint destination. After your morning tour has concluded, you will spend the afternoon exploring Patagonia at your leisure. You can choose from a variety of different activities, such as horseback riding, trekking, kayaking, fishing, or whitewater rafting. In the evening, you will return to your glampsite and spend the night dreaming beneath a spectacular sky of stars.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today will be your final day in Chile. After a leisurely breakfast, you will have a short period of time before you have to transfer to the airport. You can indulge in a final stroll through your surrounding area or just relax at your hotel. Soon, you will transfer to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: 10-Day Senior Tour to Chile
placesVisited: Santiago, Maipo Valley, Torres del Paine National Park, Punta Arenas, Valparaíso
generalInfo: On this 10-day tour of Chile, you will have all your senses enlightened by the magnificence of this South American country. From the vast landscapes of Patagonia to the cosmopolitan center of Santiago, Chile is a country that enchants nearly all who visit. Sip a glass of fine wine as you gaze out on the snow-capped Andes Mountains, experience Punta Arenas, which is one of the world’s few gateways to Antarctica, and immerse yourself in the rich culture of Santiago.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Arrive to a Welcoming Cocktail
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at the airport in Santiago, where you will be met by your private driver and transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the Lastarria neighborhood. Upon your arrival, you will have plenty of time to settle in to your suite and explore the neighborhood on your own. When you are ready, you can meet your personal tour guide in your hotel’s lobby to begin your first official tour of Chile. For your tour, you will be transferred to the summit of Santa Lucia Hill, so you can watch the sunset.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Highlight Tour of Santiago
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy a Chilean breakfast at your hotel before meeting your guide in your hotel lobby. You will begin the day with a private tour of Santiago’s top sites and neighborhoods, which will provide you with the perfect introduction to Chilean culture and history. You will venture to the trendy, bohemian neighborhood of Bellavista, where you will be stunned by the vibrant colors and impressive street art. In Bellavista, you can indulge in a visit to the infamous La Chascona, which was the home of the famed Chilean poet, Pablo Neruda. After your tour, you will be returned to your luxurious accommodation, where you will have the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Panoramic Views of the City
dayInfo.description: Today, you can indulge in a traditional breakfast before meeting your private guide in your hotel lobby to continue your exploration of Santiago. Your day will begin with an exclusive tour of the Chilean Museum of Pre-Columbian Art, where you will discover the museum’s diverse collection of artifacts that date back to the infamous empires of South America. After the museum, you will be led to the Cerro San Cristobal. Once you arrive, you will ascend to the summit of this spectacular hill via funicular, where you will delight in the spectacular views of the park and city. Upon your arrival, you will be met by the magnificent statue of the Virgin Mary, which casts its shadow over the city.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Explore the Town of Valparaiso
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can enjoy breakfast at your hotel before transferring to the coastal city of Valparaiso, which is a city that is known for its vibrant street art that covers many of its hillside buildings. Upon your arrival in the city, you will be led on an intriguing tour of the city center, Plaza Sotomayor, where you will learn a brief and interesting history about the city that you are about to explore. Your excursion will continue to the sunny, beachside city of Vina del Mar, and upon your arrival, your guide will lead you through the city’s top iconic sites. At the conclusion of your city tour, you will have the remainder of the afternoon to relax at the peaceful beaches of Vina del Mar.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Private Tour of Top Wineries
dayInfo.description: Today, you can indulge in your final breakfast in Santiago before gathering your belongings and meeting your private driver in your hotel’s lobby for a transfer to the luscious Maipo Valley. You will arrive at your luxurious accommodation, where you will have ample time to settle in and freshen up before meeting your personal tour guide to begin your explorations of the area. You will indulge in a curated tour of the Maipo Valley’s most exclusive wineries. Here, you will meet the local vintners, uncover the winemaking process, and sample the area’s top wines.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Horseback Ride through Wine Country
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can meet your guide in your hotel lobby to embark on the day’s activities. You will begin with an exciting ride through the Maipo Valley on horseback. Once your horseback riding tour has concluded, you will be transferred to a site of naturally occurring hot springs, where you will have the wonderful opportunity to bathe in these warm pools. As you luxuriate in the hot springs, your guide will treat you to platters of regional cheese and Chile’s finest vintages of wine. Whenever you are ready to return to your hotel, you will be returned, and you can enjoy the remainder of the evening relaxing at your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – The Best of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy your final breakfast in the Maipo Valley before flying to Patagonia. Once you have arrived, you will have plenty of time to get settled in to your luxurious tents, where you will first notice the beauty of Patagonia. When you are ready, you will be met by your personal guide to begin your first official exploration of the area. As every tour is specially curated for each guest, you will have the option to choose from a variety of different activities that will be available to you in this region.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Glamping in an Eco-Friendly Camp
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will traverse this rugged region via private coach. You will be guided to Patagonia’s most marvelous lookout points, which will provide you with a greater sense of the vastness of this extraordinary area. In the afternoon, you will be returned to your glampsite, where you can enjoy a fabulous lunch before deciding on the rest of your day’s activities. You will have several options to choose from, including horseback riding, whitewater rafting, fishing, kayaking, or another guided trek on one of the park’s circuits.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Private Cruise with Penguins
dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy breakfast before collecting your belongings and meeting your private driver for a transfer to the city of Punta Arenas. Upon your arrival, you will be dropped off at your luxurious accommodation, where you will settle in and freshen up. Your guide will meet you in your hotel’s lobby, where you will begin your exploration of Punta Arenas. Your tour will take the form of a private cruise through the Strait of Magellan, where you can encounter a variety of regional wildlife that characterizes this area. You will disembark briefly from your luxurious cruise on Magdalena Island, where you will be provided with the unique opportunity to immerse yourself with penguins in their natural habitat.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy your final breakfast in Chile at your hotel before spending the morning at your leisure, strolling through the charming town of Punta Arenas and appreciating the unique character of Southern Chile. As you sit down at a charming cafe that overlooks the Patagonian landscape, you may begin to reminisce about your incredible journey thus far. Before you know it, you will have to return to your hotel and collect your belongings for your transfer to the airport.

tourName: 12-Day Exploration of Chile's Diverse and Photogenic Landscapes
placesVisited: Santiago (City), Torres del Paine National Park, San Pedro de Atacama
generalInfo: Explore diverse and extreme landscapes that range from sweeping golden sand seas to flourishing floral meadows, frozen glacial mountains, red-rock moonlike rifts, and sprawling colorful neighborhoods by the sea on this 12-day Chile itinerary. Customize your adventure to suit your travel desires and have your camera ready as you journey to see the beauty of Santiago, Patagonia, and the Atacama Desert.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Views of the Andes Peaks
dayInfo.description: The modern and cultural skyline of Santiago is wedged in a valley between the soaring summits of the Andes mountains and Chilean Coast Range. The city’s historic colonial core hosts landmarks that reflect the turn of centuries, its vibrant neighborhoods boast charming cafés and expansive museums, and its lush parklands reimagine natural spaces within the city. The juxtaposition of the city and snowy peaks that flank its borders will seduce you as you transfer from the airport to accommodation around the corner from the action.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Wine Tasting in the Maipo Valley
dayInfo.description: Santiago comes to life in the morning as eateries swing open their doors and the aromas of freshly baked Alfajores , a traditional South America confection, flood the streets. After breakfast, you will browse the cafés and boutiques that pepper dashing cultural districts. In the afternoon, a private transfer and guide will introduce you to the beauty of the Maipo wine country that extends from the city’s borders. Images of the red-berried vineyards, colonial winery architecture, and rural landscapes will backdrop your lavish wine tasting of Chile’s famous Cabernet Sauvignons, Carmenere, and Bordeaux Blends.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Day Tour to Discover Valparaíso and Viña del Mar
dayInfo.description: The cultural regions of Chile boast remarkably historic landscapes and you will begin your galavant from Santiago after breakfast to the popular colorful port city of Valparaíso. Standing on the main harbor promenade, you will look back towards the city and swoon over the flurry of brightly painted homes and buildings that shine through the emerald headland. Bohemian neighborhoods, the museum La Sebastiana, and downtown Plaza Sotomayor all offer spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean and the local Chilean way of life. You will also visit the glamorous coastal resort of Viña del Mar and swim in the sapphire sea.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine National Park - Andean Arrival in Patagonia
dayInfo.description: The fourth day of your Chilean vacation will bring you to one of the most sought-after adventure travel destinations, Patagonia. The Patagonian landscapes are diverse and breathtaking. On one hand, rolling flower fields carpet the foothills of mountains and Andean forests spread from the sun-washed shores of serene lakes. On the other hand, icy glaciers cling to the archaic and monstrous mountain rock formations that scrape the clouds. You will arrive in Torres del Paine National Park and admire the contrast of green and white hues that encompasses the bewildering Chilean Patagonia landscape.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine National Park - Cross the Ascencio Valley
dayInfo.description: Several activities are available to you during your stay beneath the snowy peaks of the Andes mountains in the immense Patagonian landscapes. Hiking remains a fan favorite as it will allow you to explore the magnificent and vast beauty as authentically and personally as possible. Today, you may cross the trails that snake through mountains to the Ascencio Valley and get up close to the jaw-dropping Towers of Paine. The paths traverse lenga forests where you will spot indigenous animals and birds and streams where you may sip the fresh mountain waters before you arrive at the main lookout point.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine National Park - Capture the Grey Glacier
dayInfo.description: Having explored much of the captivating greenery of Torres del Paine the day before, you will wake up eager to capture the icy white landscapes that veil the Patagonian region. After breakfast, your guide will bring you to the Pudeto boat dock where a captain will welcome you aboard a catamaran setting sail across the frigid turquoise waters of Lake Pehoe. The cruise will reach the start of Grey Glacier trail and you will begin a moderate hike across the craggy cliffs, through forests, and out the other side to an observation point that overlooks Grey Glacier’s sprawling frozen landscape.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Witness the Purple Sunrise of Torres del Paine
dayInfo.description: Should you wish to see more of Torres del Paine before you leave for Santiago, you may wake up before sunrise and set foot along a short but beautiful trail around the corner from camp to watch the Patagonian sunrise paint the sky purple. Your roundtrip wander will bring you back to camp for breakfast and you will then transfer to the nearest airport to fly back to the Chilean capital. Your afternoon is yours to relish Santiago’s exuberant energy as you please, whether that means exploring the local cuisine or enjoying the surprising art spread across the cityscape.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama - Stargazing in the Atacama Desert
dayInfo.description: The landscapes that extend from the Andes vary from one Chilean province to the next. Today, you will leave the evergreen meadows and frosty glaciers behind for the arid deserts, sprawling salt flats, and geothermal plains of San Pedro de Atacama. You will transfer to an accommodation with impressive views of the desolate desert and then join your guide for an astronomical tour in the evening. With practically no light pollution affecting the skies, the Atacama desert remains the foremost stargazing spot in the world. You will look up and admire the cosmos as you spot planets and celestial bodies.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama - Floating On the Waters of Chaxa
dayInfo.description: You will wake up, step outside onto your porch, and bask in the golden sunlight that spreads across the seemingly endless desert expanse. The beauty of being completely alone in this arid desert wonderland will dawn on you as you sip coffee without another soul in sight. After breakfast, your tour guide will chaperone you on an excursion to Chaxa lagoon and the Salar de Atacama salt pan. Crystals line the edge of the salt pan and the lagoon’s dense salty waters will allow you to float effortlessly. Afterward, you will visit the former gold mining village of Socaire.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama - Tatio Geysers and Valle de la Luna
dayInfo.description: With only the immense geothermal landscapes left to tick off your extraordinary Chilean travel bucket list, you will eagerly adventure to the Tatio Geysers after breakfast. The impressive bubbling springs, babbling geothermal streams, and steaming crevices from which a thick mist billows out of the Earth’s crust are highlights that make for beautiful landscape photography. After a swim in the springs, you will continue to the salt caves, Licancabur Volcano, and the moonlike dunes of the Valle de la Luna to complete your adventure across Atacama's awe-inspiring geothermal and desert scenery.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Back to the Beginning
dayInfo.description: Your Chilean adventure will end where it began, in the bustling cosmopolitan capital of Santiago. Before you transfer to the closest airport to your Atacama accommodation, you may spend the morning appreciating the pleasant isolation of this far-flung destination and snapshot the indigenous flora and fauna that somehow thrives amidst the harsh desert conditions. After breakfast, you will return to Santiago and spend the rest of your day as you please. You may watch live musicians play at hip bars, tuck into traditional cuisine at family-run restaurants, and wander the bohemian neighborhoods during sunset.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - So Long, Santiago
dayInfo.description: A new day in Santiago will bring with it new opportunities to appreciate the local Chilean culture and flavor before you pack your things and transfer to the airport. You will savor a delightful breakfast at your accommodation and may then step outside to immerse yourself in the South American energy one last time. You may peruse the colorful stores or grab a refreshment and head for the lush parks, visit inspiring museums, or photograph the cityscape from the summit of San Cristobal Hill if timing permits.

tourName: 14 Day Chile and Argentina Tour: Luxury Lodges & Beautiful Boutique Hotels
placesVisited: Mendoza, Buenos Aires, Santiago, Torres del Paine, Punta Arenas
generalInfo: Luxurious spas and incomparable views, perfect locations and pristine accommodations, fantastic amenities and friendly staffs all come together to give you a unique perspective on life in Latin America. And with exciting activities on your incomparable Chile and Argentina tour, even if you don’t remember where you stayed, you’ll never forget what you saw here.

dayInfo.title: Welcome to Chile!
dayInfo.description: The morning sees you landing in gorgeous Chile in her proud and unforgettable capital of Santiago. After dropping your bags off at your darling boutique hotel in the heart of one Santiago’s plushest and most elegant neighborhoods, spend some time discovering the urban gems of this stunning metropolis. Reach the summit of Cerro San Cristobal for a breath-taking view of the city and its environs and the rising peaks of the Andes on the horizon. Or, engage in a little retail therapy at Nueva Costanera Avenue or Alonso de Cordova Street, where you can find the finest European fashion houses as well as the best examples of Chilean high fashion. The evenings can be spent at one of Santiago’s best restaurants—the best are found in Isabella Goyenechea—or music clubs, from jazz to pop to rock and roll.

dayInfo.title: Discovering Chile’s Captivating Capital
dayInfo.description: After a hearty breakfast at your elegant hotel, hit the streets and see the sights of Santiago. Art lovers will want to visit the National Museum of Fine Arts or the Modern Art Museum in scenic Parque Forestal, a long stretch of city greenery that runs along the banks of the Mapocho River. Those intrigued by Chile’s literary heritage would enjoy a visit to La Chascona, one of the three homes of the unrivaled love poet Pablo Neruda. The home is set in the artsy neighborhood of Bellavista and holds a myriad of fascinating artifacts from the writer’s life, as well as pieces of art done by some of his notable acquaintances. Great views and exquisite architecture can be found at Cerro Santa Lucia while more examples of Santiago’s spectacular edifices can be found at the Palacio Cousino. This evening, search out one of Santiago’s famous jazz clubs: the Club de Jazz de Santiago in the northern section of the Nunoa neighborhood is regarded as the city’s best.

dayInfo.title: Spending Some Time in Santiago
dayInfo.description: Your final day in this magical metropolis gives you a chance to see everything you might have missed. Visit the steps of the Iglesia y Museo de San Francisco—the capital’s oldest church. Enjoy the exhibits at the Museo Chileno de Arte Precolombino, one of the city’s newest museums, where you’ll find artifacts from various Native American cultures, from the colossal heads of the Olmec to Andean mummies that predate their Egyptian cousins by centuries. Walk the paths at Parque Bicentenario, one of the most beautiful in the city, or take in a play, dance or opera at the historic Teatro Municipal: even if the theater doesn’t interest you, the striking exterior and sumptuous concert halls are worth visiting. Outdoor enthusiasts will find a number of activities dedicated to exploring Santiago’s numerous nearby peaks while oenophiles might want to spend the day trekking out to Chile’s burgeoning wine country, where they can learn more about Chilean viticulture and sample some of the best varietals and blends of the region.

dayInfo.title: Into the Heart of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: Today, venture deep into the southern wilds of Chilean Patagonia , named by Magellan for the legendary race of giants—the Patagones—who allegedly roamed the area’s plains and plateaus. After landing in Punta Arenas, the regional capital and main jumping off point for exploring southern Chile, you’ll be taken to your unique and unforgettable lodgings in the breathtaking Torres del Paine National Park. You’ll be wowed by the gorgeous scenery, from the spectacular collision of snow-capped peaks and brilliant sky to the verdant hills surrounding azure lakes. The majestic grandeur of Torres del Paine is sure to make a nature-lover out of even the most die-hard urbanite, and the myriad activities and touring options will give you plenty of opportunities to experience the awesome power of nature to the fullest.

dayInfo.title: Exploring the Domain of the Blue Towers
dayInfo.description: Today is a celebration of Mother Earth, dedicated to discovering some of her most fantastic and fascinating formations. Hike along the Rio Pongo where you’ll find an unforgettable series of waterfalls, or take a horseback ride through the park to the banks of Lake Pehoe at the feet of Los Cuernos, two of the area’s most spectacular peaks. Make your way through one of the park’s many lakes to take in the beautiful power of the mountain glaciers that dot the landscape, from the opaque and mammoth face of the Serrano Glacier to the imposing Grey Glacier, which makes up nearly an entire edge of the Great Southern Ice Field. Shorter hikes will take you along the Margarita and Marco Antonio Lagoons while boat rides throughout the park offer fantastic new perspectives on the craggy peaks on the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Returning to Santiago
dayInfo.description: Enjoy one final meal in the unmatched surroundings of Torres del Paine before returning to Punta Arenas, set to return to the city streets of Chile’s cosmopolitan capital. With one more night to spend in Santiago, you’ll want to live it up like a local. Enjoy a delicious meal of freshly caught seafood or perfectly prepared beef. Have a glass of delicious Chilean wine while enjoying the vibrant nightlife of Santiago’s poshest areas. Jazz clubs and upscale bars are everywhere to be found, and people of all ages are celebrating the coming of another evening and its attendant revelries.

dayInfo.title: Crossing the Border into Argentina
dayInfo.description: Your final morning in Chile sees you off after breakfast, taking you to Santiago’s airport to fly to the gastronomic center of Argentina and the center of the largest wine producing region in Latin America: Mendoza. Upon your arrival in Mendoza, you’ll be escorted to your stunning boutique hotel, offering eye-opening views of the Andean foothills, tours of local vineyards, wine tastings, and an opulent spa. You’ll want to get out and explore this fascinating city as soon as you check in. The city itself is an often over-looked gem unto itself, filled with gorgeous city parks like the Plaza Independencia and Plaza Espana, a number of high-quality museums, and vistas of the rising peaks that ring the city. Have dinner at any number of Mendoza’s excellent restaurants, but 1884 is generally regarded as offering the finest dining in the city.

dayInfo.title: Touring Argentina’s Wine Country
dayInfo.description: Nowhere on Earth has experienced the explosion of enotourism quite like Mendoza, and today gives you the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of some of Argentina’s up-and-coming wineries and taste some of the region’s famous vintages, most notably the bold and juicy Malbecs that have made the area—and the country—one of the Great Capitals of Wine. Explore the Valle de Uco, one of the very best viticultural regions in the nation, or the higher and drier plains of Maipu, where perhaps the finest Malbec grapes in the world can be found. You’ll learn about the fascinating history of Argentina’s wine industry, the swift rise to chicness of Malbecs and South American blends, and the environmental factors that all converge to make this one of the most productive wine regions on the planet. Set up a private tasting at one of the nearby wineries, plan an opulent lunch where each delicious course comes with a corresponding wine, or simply walk through the long lines of grapevines that spread seemingly endlessly across the land’s wide expanse.

dayInfo.title: One More Day in Marvelous Mendoza
dayInfo.description: Spend your final day in Mendoza encountering the unique architecture, beautiful parks and friendly people that make this city one of Argentina’s most popular tourist destinations. Tour the monuments to Mendoza’s absorbing past, from Cerro de la Gloria, a stolid mountain crowned by a captivating, dramatic sculpture commemorating the battalions of the Liberating Army of the Andes, to the gorgeous Basilica de San Francisco, built in the late 19th-century and containing a statue dedicated to la Virgen del Carmen de Cuyo and the walking stick of Jose de San Martin, the leader of the 19th-century Argentine resistance. You can also stroll the grounds of General San Martin Park. From the brilliant blue lake and the rolling contours of the Mendoza Yacht Club to the serenity of the Rose Garden, the Mendoza Zoological Park, or the intricate and elegant wrought iron gates at the park’s entrance.

dayInfo.title: Turning East to Argentina’s Cosmopolitan Capital
dayInfo.description: After a delicious breakfast in your Mendoza hotel, you’ll be taken to the airport for a flight to the northeast of Argentina and the wide and gleaming streets of her unmatched capital, Buenos Aires. Your accommodations while in Buenos Aires are a gorgeous and charming boutique hotel in the center of the Palermo Soho barrio , one of the city’s hippest neighborhoods, with wide tree-lined streets and innumerable restaurants, bars and boutiques. After dropping off your bags, start reconnoitering this vast and action-packed metropolis, from the bright storefronts and apartments in La Boca to the understated elegance of Recoleta. You can start your explorations of Buenos Aires’s vibrant culinary scene on a guided tour of a number of parrillas , or just walk the streets of nearby Palermo Viejo where bookstores and small clothing stores line the winding cobblestone streets.

dayInfo.title: Your First Full Day in Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Today offers the chance to wake in the midst of this spectacular world capital and engage in some activities that might require the whole day. Daredevils will want to try to schedule a trip up into the clear sparkling blue of Buenos Aires’s skies and take in the cityscape while they plummet to Earth with one the city’s highly-rated skydiving companies. Do some shopping in Belgrano or on Florida Street in the Microcentro, or simply walk the dockyards of the renewed Puerto Madero, where nature lovers will find the excellent Reserva Ecologica Costanera Sur. Theater-goers will certainly want to saunter around the Tribunales barrio , where they can find Avenida Corrientes (Buenos Aires’s answer to Broadway and London’s East End) and the imposing façade and unparalleled acoustics of Teatro Colon, the capital’s main opera house and one of the very best concert venues on the planet.

dayInfo.title: Trying the Tango, Argentina’s National Dance
dayInfo.description: Nothing better expresses and encapsulates Buenos Aires’s storied past—its passionate history, the powerful influences of the immigrant population, the lower-class desires, and upper-class elegance—than the tango, one of the most famous dances in the world and the unquestionable artistic legacy of Argentina. Tango clubs and street demonstrations can be found throughout the city, but some barrios are better than others if you’re looking for the authentic artistry of this fiery dance, with Boedo standing as the preeminent tango neighborhood in the city. You can learn the steps yourself from either a tango studio or with private lessons, where you’ll encounter not only the intricacies of this incredible art form but the cultural backgrounds of its main practitioners. In the evening you can take in dinner and a tango show at one of the numerous underground tango clubs throughout the city, or night owls can venture out to a milonga , a sort of tango club, where the evening sessions will last until four or five in the morning.

dayInfo.title: Recoleta, Casa Rosada and the Rest of Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in Latin America can be spent exploring wherever you might have missed in your first two days in Argentina’s capital. Learn about Argentina’s complex and sometimes troubling history at the steps of the Casa Rosada, the “Pink House” that serves as the executive mansion and office of the President of Argentina. Also, visit the nearby Plaza de Mayo, a hub of political life in Argentina built around the Piramide de Mayo, the oldest national monument in the city. Then, head to the upscale neighborhood of Recoleta and its venerable cemetery. The cemetery is named one of the most beautiful in the world; it houses the remains of many of Argentina’s political, cultural and social elites, including Eva Peron, more than a dozen presidents of Argentina, and the first Latin American recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize.

dayInfo.title: Saying Goodbye to South America
dayInfo.description: Argentina tours aren't complete without a traditional Argentine breakfast. Enjoy a wonderful feast on your last morning and then prepare to leave fabulous South America behind. You will leave with lifelong memories and plans to return to this incredible region as soon as possible.

tourName: Amazing Chile Highlights Tour: Atacama, Patagonia, Wine Country, and More
placesVisited: Santiago de Chile, San Pedro, Torres del Paine National Park, Patagonia
generalInfo: Discover diverse beauty and remarkable flavors during your customizable 10-day Chile highlights tour. Traverse the terrain of the salt flats in the north and hike beyond boulders for immaculate views of the Torres del Paine towers in Patagonia. From wine tasting in the celebrated Colchagua Valley to gazing at the pristine starlight in the Atacama Desert, your Chile tour will reveal the endless allure of the natural landscape and distinctive Chilean culture.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Arrive in Chile’s Capital City with an Introductory Tour
dayInfo.description: Santiago de Chile is a multicultural metropolis that offers stunning views of the Andes Mountains. The energetic streets host a combination of expansive museums, premium restaurants, and distinctive bohemian flair. You will be met upon arrival at the Santiago airport and transferred to your luxurious accommodation in Las Condes, which is one of the hippest neighborhoods in town. After settling in to the comforts of your accommodations, you will be met in your hotel’s lobby for a private half-day city tour of Santiago. Your tour will include the Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes, which is the city’s premier fine arts museum, and the Pre-Columbian Art Museum, whose remarkable collection includes art from Mayan, Aztec, Incan, Mapuche, and other major indigenous cultures. When exploring the Pre-Columbian Art Museum, your guide will explain the history and heritage of the artifacts in connection with the culture of Chile. Your tour will also visit the Plaza de Armas and the neighborhoods of Providencia, Bellavista, and Las Condes. Santiago offers an extensive range of sophisticated dining options, and your guide can provide you with recommendations based on your preferences.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Discover the Treasured Wines of the Colchagua Valley
dayInfo.description: The Colchagua Valley is one of Chile’s most famous wine-growing regions and has helped bring Chilean wines to the international stage. Mountains surround the valley, creating a unique topography that feeds into the diverse flavors of the wines. The region also possesses a history that dates back to the Spanish conquest in the 16th century. Your guide will meet you at your hotel after breakfast and escort you to the valley for a private wine-tasting tour, featuring a selection of celebrated vineyards. You will have your first sampling of Chilean wines at a vineyard that embodies unique tastes and settings. The vineyard is nestled along the edges of the hillside that overlooks the Apalta Valley. The main building nearly blends into the landscape and looks as though it has emerged from the foothills of the edging mountains. Your guide will lead you on a tour that encompasses the building design and the winemaking process before allowing you to enter the tasting room, which is where you will sample the wine. The cabernet sauvignon hosts the layered aromas of cherries and cassis that give way to a delicate balance of tannins with a slight raspberry flavor.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro – Travel to San Pedro de Atacama with the Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: San Pedro de Atacama combines the charm of an antique desert town with the endless beauty of the surrounding landscape. The old plaza showcases the town’s relaxed pace near the city’s historic church. The Craft Village represents the traditions that have been kept alive by locals and features images of the desert, from geysers to wildlife. In the morning, your private transfer will meet you in your hotel’s lobby after breakfast to escort you to the airport for your flight to San Pedro de Atacama, where you will continue with a private transfer to the comforts of your accommodations in the heart of the town. In the evening, you can reach for the stars by visiting the Astronomical Facilities that are internationally renowned and draw nearly 40 international universities to the desert. The collection of 66 high precision antennas are positioned close to 16,404 feet above sea level and help showcase the crystal-clear skies for unparalleled stargazing. Your stargazing experience will be complete with telescopes, and you can gaze through a series of four 26.9-foot telescopic lenses. You can also witness the starlight and the detailed craters on the moon with some of the most precise equipment on Earth.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro – Witness the Landscape of the Atacama Desert
dayInfo.description: The morning will bring traces of herbaceous aromas, which derives from mate tea as it brews in the dining room and throughout the town. Your guide will meet you at your hotel’s lobby after breakfast to lead you to the distinctive landscape of the Atacama Salt Flats. The expansive landscape spreads across 1,200 square miles and represents the third-largest salt flats in the world. The scenery will resemble freshly fallen snow as it spreads across the flatland to the foothills of the distant mountains. Your guide will lead you to the Chaxa Lagoon inside Los Flamencos National Reserve. The entire lagoon is separated into several lakes by quays of salt crust, and the waters host lively flocks of Chilean, Andean, and James’s flamingos. The Chilean flamingo can grow up to 51 inches tall and feed mainly on algae and plankton. You will find them lingering in the water and foraging in the lagoon by using their beaks to dig into the mud. At lunch, you can enjoy the charming town of Toconao as the bells from the 18th-century three-tiered bell tower of the church ring.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro – Traverse the Scenery of Chile’s Atacama Desert
dayInfo.description: The Valley of the Moon is located approximately eight miles outside of San Pedro de Atacama and highlights the unique contours of the desert landscape. Your guide will lead you to the valley to reveal the shapes, colors, and inhospitable soils that resemble the moon’s surface. The wind and rain have caused thousands of years of sand and stone erosion that still sustains a surprising abundance of flora and fauna. The surrounding mountains create a frame for the valley, where you can wander through the distinctive structures of the salt, gypsum, and clay. Your guide will explain the features and history of Salt Cave, and the sunlight will glint against the cavernous space to reveal the sparkling salt crystals. In the silence of the cave, you will be able to hear the subtle crackle of the salt as the land shifts beneath your feet. Near the end of your tour, you can venture to the top of the giant sand dunes that will make you feel as though you have traveled far from earth. The top of the dune will offer a stunning 360-degree view of the Valley of the Moon and the endless desert landscape.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Transfer to Patagonia at Torres del Paine National
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel early in the morning to escort you to the airport for your flight to Puerto Natales. The city will act as the gateway to Chile’s Patagonia and the celebrated landscape of Torres del Paine National Park. The former fishing port will offer a colorful introduction to the region with its corrugated-tin homes that line the waterway along the Seno Ultima Esperanza. Your private driver will meet you at the airport and lead you away from the bustling city streets to reach the dramatic scenery of Torres del Paine National Park as viewed from your luxury resort. The national park covers more than 448,000 acres of protected land, including the renowned towers of the Paine massif. From your hotel, you can bask in the raw power of the mountains and shimmering waters of Lake Sarmiento to settle in to the serene comforts of Patagonia. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in the marvelous views or to partake in an excursion into the wilderness for an introduction into the unforgiving and untouched terrain.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Explore the Patagonian Steppe at your Pace
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you can step into the dramatic landscape at your pace to discover the marvels of Torres del Paine National Park. For an exciting view of the pristine scenery, you can follow your guide to Mirador Ferrier. The challenging hike will lead you along a scattered trail that winds between waterways and steep foothills before reaching a prominence of up to 2,296 feet. Your guide will point out the huemul deer as you venture through the scenery. The endangered deer has a population of approximately 2,000 across the Patagonian Steppe. When you reach the lookout, you will discover an unobstructed view of Glacier Pingo and Glacier Grey. The icy surfaces will glint in the sunlight and resemble waves frozen in action as the ice wraps around the rugged edges of the mountains. Grey Glacier reaches an altitude of 3,937 feet above sea level and overtakes an area of more than 104 square miles, while the imposing peak of Mount Ferrier looms behind you at more than 3,000 feet above sea level.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Continue Uncovering the Scenery of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you can make your way across the grasslands and rivers of Patagonia on a guided horseback riding excursion. Your guide will help you pick the perfect horse for your experience before allowing you to venture into the captivating landscape for a hint of gaucho culture. Your guide will offer you an authentic view of the landscape in addition to the traditions of Chilean cowboys. You may notice his customary clothing of espadrilles with rope, canvas, pure cotton trousers, and a poncho, which protects them from the cold of the pampas. You will make your way to the shores of Lake Toro and through the waters of the Serrano River, which flows into the lake at the northwest corner. During your journey, you will be able to enjoy the shimmering surface of the lake from the shoreline before gliding across the water on a kayak for a different perspective of the surrounding national park.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Venture to See Torres del Paine Massif
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will set out once more into the depths of Torres del Paine to discover the marvelous views and tremendous wildlife that is featured in the national park. You can follow a guide or make your own way along the Mirador Las Torres trail to reach the lookout that highlights the renowned towers of the massif. The challenging hike will lead you alongside the waters of the El Salto Grande Waterfall, where the whitewater splashes into the river. The icy blue water will demonstrate the chilling temperatures of the glacial waters as you make your way closer to the foothills. Your guide will point out guanaco as they forage on the grass. This relative of the llama can grow to nearly four feet tall from hoof to shoulder and can survive live at elevations of 13,000 feet above sea level. When you reach Mirador Las Torres, you will find a spectacular view that features the granite towers of Torres del Paine that reach approximately 8,202 feet above sea level. The epic image of the three towers will reflect on the surface of the glacier-fed lake in the foreground.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can bask in the subtle herbaceous aroma of mate tea while watching over the rippling waters of the lake. You can also relax with an early-morning spa treatment, which can soothe your muscles after traversing the rugged wilderness on foot and horseback. Your private driver will meet you at your resort after breakfast to transfer you to Puerto Natales for your flight back to Santiago, where you will connect with your international flight.

tourName: Buenos Aires, Mendoza & Santiago Wine Tour
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Mendoza, Santiago de Chile
generalInfo: From a bold and velvety Argentine Malbec to the distinct flavor and nose of a Chilean Cabernet, the wines of South America are as spectacular as the landscapes from which they come. With South America’s greatest cities a short plane ride away, you’ll understand why these are the regions that France and Napa don’t want you to discover.

dayInfo.title: Touching Down in South America
dayInfo.description: You arrive this morning on the outskirts of one of South America’s most cosmopolitan cities, beautiful and bright Buenos Aires, where the sophistication of Europe meets the passion of Latin America, where the streets hum with activity and the smells of a perfectly grilled steak fill your nose. A car will meet you at the airport to take you to your luxurious, comfortable hotel, where you can drop off your luggage and set out to explore everything city has to offer. You’ll find the streets awash with color and full of life, with local Argentines ringing in the approach of night in fine fashion, preparing for a long and exciting evening. Dinner can be had at one of the city’s excellent parrillas , where the local beef offers a delicious complement to the rich and sumptuous notes of a glass of the country’s best Malbecs.

dayInfo.title: Half-Day Tour and a Tango Show in Argentina’s Captivating Capital
dayInfo.description: After a delicious Argentine breakfast at the hotel, set out on a half-day tour that will show you all the highlights of this incredible metropolis. You’ll discover the tranquil and scenic neighborhoods of Retiro and Palermo and witness the extraordinary span of the Avenida de 9 de Julio, the widest avenue in the world. Walk the length of this remarkable thoroughfare to take in some of Buenos Aires’s most famous monuments, from the stately façade of the French embassy to the soaring Obelisk marking the Plaza de la Republica, from the statue of Don Quijote at the avenue’s intersection with Avenida de Mayo to the immense and spectacular Teatro Colon. Then turn to the city’s political heart, like the Plaza de Mayo, the center of political protests in Argentina for decades, and the famous Casa Rosada, the Pink House that serves as the executive mansion for the President of Argentina. Revel in the newly restored and the splendid scenery at the Puerto Madero and the colonial homes and elegant wrought-iron lanterns that line the cobblestone streets of San Telmo. You’ll also make stops at Francia Square and to the lively and colorful neighborhood of La Boca, where the multihued shops reflect the liveliness and excitements of this vivacious barrio . This evening features a true Argentine treat as you’ll head out to Esquina Carlos Gardel (one of the best-known tango show venues) for a delicious dinner and a performance of Argentina’s national dance, the tango. You’ll be captivated by the passion of this beautiful and iconic dance, and with some of the city’s best culinary offerings before as well, this is sure to be a night you’ll remember for the rest of your life.

dayInfo.title: Another Day of Independent Exploration or Option Activities in Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Today you continue your explorations of Buenos Aires either on your own or with a guided tour that will show you the city’s brilliant buildings or its finest art galleries: you can also engage in guided tours centered on the city’s architecture, its culinary traditions, its street art, or its Jewish heritage, just to name a few. If you’d rather go it alone, you can perambulate along Avenida Corrientes, Buenos Aires’s answer to Broadway and the West End, or do some shopping in a posh barrio like Palermo Viejo or in the Microcentro at Florida and Lavalle Streets. Visitors will also want to check out the incomparable scene at El Ateneo Grand Splendid, a bookstore housed in a former theater that is widely regarded as one of the most beautiful on the planet. After an afternoon of relaxation at your hotel, you’ll enjoy another stirring local performance of the tango with an accompanying dinner. Then, discover some of Buenos Aires’s best night spots: the Krakow Café Bar in San Telmo is particularly well-known.

dayInfo.title: Turning West to the Foothills of the Andes
dayInfo.description: After breakfast at your hotel, you will be picked up and transferred to the airport. Board a plane and turn to the high plains of Argentina’s Mendoza Province, where the altitude, rainfall, and temperature all combine to create one of the finest viticultural areas in the entire world, and the largest wine-growing region in all of Latin America. You’ll be transported from the airport to your selected hotel located either in downtown Mendoza or the trendy Chacras de Coria neighborhood. Relax with a glass of wine that comes from wineries mere minutes away, or engage in some of the hotel’s offered activities or simply walking the grounds.

dayInfo.title: A Full Day of Sightseeing in the Mountains, and Viewing Aconcagua
dayInfo.description: Today features a full-day excursion into the teeth of the towering Andes Mountains, a range that runs along the entire western coast of South America and which imbues the area with the powerful majesty of some of the tallest peaks in the Western Hemisphere. Weather permitting you’ll be able to catch a glimpse of the cragged summit of Aconcagua, the tallest peak in the Americas and the highest point on land outside of Asia. You will drive on to the border with Chile (Las Cuevas) before passing the jagged and bewildering Penitentes, snow formations that resemble contrite sinners kneeling for forgiveness. You will also pass the astounding Puente del Inca, a natural arch spanning the Vacas River that was visited and recorded by Charles Darwin during his South American journeys in the early 19th-century. The evening sees you back in Mendoza, where dinner can be as lavish or as laid-back as you please: 1884 is one of the city’s most famous restaurants and features local meat and produce while Il Panino offers a more tranquil atmosphere as well as the best pizza in the city.

dayInfo.title: Enjoying the Fruits of Argentina’s Wine Region: A Full Day Guided Wine Tour
dayInfo.description: Get ready to experience Argentina’s Wine Country at its best today as you’re scheduled to visit three hand selected wineries, from the giant and prestigious growers to boutique wineries that excel at producing their own blends as well as some of the finest Malbecs around. Guides will explain how Mendoza’s temperature and irrigation systems create the perfect environment for delicious wines that are fruity yet deep, full yet delicate, and always delectable. With an eclectic and engaging mix of old wineries and new, large-scale and intimate, industry newcomers and famous names alike, by the end of the day, you’ll find it almost impossible to say which was your favorite. Lunch is a gourmet affair, with each course bringing with it wine that is sure to complement perfectly the complex flavors of the cuisine and offer a pleasant balance to every offering, from hearty steaks to sublime desserts. And with gorgeous vistas of the surrounding countryside and friendly and helpful people leading your journey, today is sure to be a true adventure in taste.

dayInfo.title: Goodbye Argentina, Hello Chile
dayInfo.description: Transfer from your hotel to Mendoza’s airport and board a flight to Santiago, the charming capital of Chile nestled between the Andes and the Pacific, where you can ski in the morning, surf in the afternoon and spend the evening living up the nightlife like a true Chilean. Spend some time to recharge at your beautiful and exciting hotel in the heart of the action before experiencing Santiago’s nightlife for the first time. There are a number of delicious seafood restaurants here—Ocean Pacific and Aqui Esta Coco are particularly recommended. For the best jazz scene on the continent, visit small clubs featuring local artists or famous clubs that host international superstars. The city’s best, the Club de Jazz de Santiago, can be found in the northern section of the Nunoa neighborhood.

dayInfo.title: Visiting Vina del Mar and Valparaiso
dayInfo.description: Today takes you to the Chilean coast to explore two of her most famous port cities, the inimitable metropolises of Viña del Mar and Valparaiso, known affectionately as “The Garden City” and “The Jewel of the Pacific,” respectively. Your bilingual guide will share all the secrets of these scenic cities and hit all the highlights, from the Flower Clock near Caleta Abarca beach in Viña del Mar to the Historic Quarter of Valparaiso, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2003. There is history and high culture throughout these two famous ports: Valparaiso alone can claim Latin America’s oldest stock exchange and its first volunteer fire department, the first public library in Chile and the oldest continuously published Spanish language newspaper on Earth. Viña del Mar’s attractions are no less impressive: visit the Fonck Museum to catch a glimpse of a large moai, the only one of its kind in mainland Chile, or walk the grounds and the halls of Palacio Carrasco, a National Historic Monument that includes a Rodin sculpture right outside the entrance. Evening sees you back in Santiago, where you can regale in the city’s nightlife once again: grab a drink at Boomerang, an upscale pub and cocktail bar in Providencia, or walk the street Isidora Goyenechea to find a restaurant for the evening.

dayInfo.title: A Day of Wine in Chile’s Central Valley
dayInfo.description: Return to the foothills of the Andes for a full-day excursion into the Central Valleys to taste some of the best of Chile’s wines, from the ancient and venerable grapes of the Maule Valley to the newly planted fields of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenere, and Chardonnay that have helped put Chile on the world wine map. Four unique and eclectic valleys offer seemingly endless opportunities to engage your inner oenophile, from the sprawling verdant vines of Colchagua Valley to the rolling hills and gentle undulations of the Curico Valley. You will be able to see of these valleys in one day. If you extend your stay, you can visit additional valleys and spend a night in one of the fabulous resorts. Located directly across the Andes from Mendoza, these sites give you the chance to observe how small differences in climate and location create radically different wines that are nevertheless similar in their exceptional quality. Tours of the wineries and vineyards will give you a first-hand look at the incredible advancements in wine growing technology that have assisted in Chile’s rise in the international wine market. The evening sees you back in Santiago, ready for one final night in thrilling South America.

dayInfo.title: Saying Goodbye to the Southern Cone
dayInfo.description: After one last morning in Santiago, you will be escorted to the airport to return home after an adventure filled with fine food, fine wine and fine times. You will already be aching to return to this scenic and memorable continent.

tourName: Chile Adventure Tour: Snowcapped Peaks to High Deserts
placesVisited: Santiago (City), Pucón, Valle Nevado, Atacama Desert
generalInfo: Absolute hiking and skiing adventure awaits on this captivating 13-day tour across the remarkably varied environments of Chile. From the cityscape of Santiago to the sprawling wilderness of Pucón, the snowy summits of Valle Nevado to the unending desert of Atacama, you will uncover every idyllic inch of Chile’s most memorable hiking and skiing destinations.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Saying Hello to South America
dayInfo.description: Towering towards the clouds beneath the majestic snow-capped mountain peaks of the Andes lies the sprawling skyline of Santiago, Chile’s capital city. As you swoop down towards the international airport, the sunshine will peek through the fluffy clouds and flood its cosmopolitan cityscape with a luminous glow. Transfering to your accommodation in a lively Santiago district, you will sense the magical blend of historic culture and contemporary innovations that compose the distinct South American city of Santiago, a leafy base for over 40% of the population.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Wildlife Wonders below the Andes Mountains
dayInfo.description: Santiago is dripping with cultural highlights to explore. After breakfast, witness the otherworldly allure of the city’s surrounding wilderness uncovered within the mesmerizing Yerba Loca Nature Sanctuary. The far-flung forested paradise welcomes visitors who jump off the beaten path, and you will be amongst a select few that venture into these flourishing fields and rolling hills to see what constitutes untouched Chile. A brisk hike will reveal scenic panoramas of the soaring Andes Mountains, icy glaciers sweeping the hillsides, and endemic creatures that reside in the unspoiled environment.

dayInfo.title: Pucón - Peaceful Moments Spent Lazing in Pucón
dayInfo.description: Adventure is inherent in the lake-lying city of Pucón, a destination gateway to the enchanting rainforests and staggering powdery peaks of the volcanic Villarrica mountain. This idyllic locale is regarded as one of the most exciting across Chile as its copious activities satiate the adventurous spirit of all those who grace these untamed parts. Before encountering the unending environmental discoveries that veil greater Pucón, you will have an afternoon to simply gaze out across the proliferating countryside as the gentle wind rolls through the trees.

dayInfo.title: Pucón - Splendid Strolls in the Spectacular Villarrica National Park
dayInfo.description: You will discover the illustrious scenery of Villarrica up close as you step foot in the region's national park and begin trekking through its blooming mountain landscape. As you stroll along shaded pathways and open-air fields cascading the precipice, you will encounter giant volcanic rocks embedded into the cliffside and vegetation growing from every nook and cranny of the forest. Your journey will be set to the soundtrack of singing birds which you may spot if you peer between the branches of overhanging trees en route to glittering scenes of the lake and colossal caves cut into the rocky outcrops.

dayInfo.title: Pucón - Racing Down the Rocky Rapids of the Trancura River
dayInfo.description: It is one thing to encounter the environment by foot, and a completely different experience to see it by raft, a thrilling activity you will be delighted to partake in during your third day amongst Pucón’s wilderness. Guided by an experienced ranger and equipped with high-quality gear, you will race down the speedy streams over rocky rapids and around sharp bends past a series of remarkable geological wonders, including the Garganta Del Diablo and the Metreñehue. Your adrenalin-filled day will come to a beautiful conclusion as you watch the sunset over the snowy scenes from the serenity of your secluded balcony.

dayInfo.title: Pucón - Postcard Memories of the Puesco Andean Lagoons
dayInfo.description: Your adventures today will bring you back to the expansive Villarrica National Park, though this time to the glistening Puesco Andean lagoons that lay speckled across the vast viridian landscape. Monkeys will be seen swinging from the trees flanking the tranquil waters of the Quillelhue, Perdida, and Huenfiuca lagoons, while black-necked swans and red-gartered coot will gracefully hover over the gently flowing natural pools coating the leafy forest floor. With not a single soul or human-made construct insight, you will feel the blissful sensation of being one with nature as you calmly hike this picture-perfect park.

dayInfo.title: Valle Nevado - Step Foot on the Snow-Capped Summits of Chile
dayInfo.description: Up to this point of your trip, you will have come to appreciate the incredible natural Chilean allure that lies at the foothills of the looming mountains spreading across the landscape. Today, however, you will ascend the powdery peaks and step foot in the snow that lays gentle along the steep cliffs like a white blanket keeping the rocky mountain warm. You will check into your elegant accommodation in the Euro-centric ski resort stationed on one of the largest ski regions in South America for a few days of snowy splendor soaring above sea level.

dayInfo.title: Valle Nevado - Skiing Snowy Slopes beneath the Golden Sun
dayInfo.description: You will have unlimited access to the many ski-lifts located around the resort, which will send you flying to the crests of imposing mountains boasting a collection of stimulating ski trails. Zigzagging down the steep slopes, you will take pleasure in the surreal sights of the sheer precipices overhanging the spreading snowy landscape below while the sounds of the gentle gusts breeze across the surface. Whether new to the sport or an experienced professional, there are trails to suit your specific level across the riveting resort.

dayInfo.title: Valle Nevado - Sit Back and Relax on a Stunning Snowy Peak
dayInfo.description: With another day to immerse yourself in the fantastic skiing opportunities presented at the prestigious resort, you may set off early in the morning to hit the slopes before others join you. Freeing up time in the afternoon, you may spend it savoring the top-tier amenities offered at your accommodation, whether you wish to kick back and relax while the fragrant aromas pouring from the kitchen send your taste buds into a frenzy or vitalize your mind and body with a warming spa therapy at the world-class facility.

dayInfo.title: Atacama Desert - Mountain Biking across the Famous Death Valley
dayInfo.description: You will have explored Chile’s flourishing rainforests and spent time luxuriating on the snowy soaring mountain ranges, but, today you will transfer to an entirely new environment in the form of the treasured Atacama Desert.
