dayInfo.description: You will fly to Easter island in the morning and arrive at Mataveri Airport to meet your transfer to a gorgeous hotel. Rapa Nui maintains a mystical allure a world away from Chilean culture and embodied in the strikingly familiar moai, the enigmatic statues. From your hotel, you can enjoy unobstructed views of the Pacific Ocean as the water laps against the tranquil coastline leading to the luscious windswept grasses. The island has a personable and intimate feeling enhanced by a magnetic allure that will quickly welcome you to the land, sea, and culture.

dayInfo.title: Hanga Roa - Wander Natural and Cultural Beauty
dayInfo.description: You will step into the island wilderness with your guide for a morning hike to the highest point at Terevaka Anakena, which reaches 1,635 feet above sea level. The panoramic view will sweep across the entire island giving way to the glistening cobalt colors of the Pacific Ocean. At Anakena Beach, the palm groves shade the sands and the water offers a refreshing tropical temperature perfect for a swim. You will continue to the 15 moai of Mahatua Ovahe . The fully preserved statues capture the grandeur of the archeological marvels as they overlook the coastline and fishing cove.

dayInfo.title: Hanga Roa - Cycle and Snorkel around Easter Island
dayInfo.description: Your excursion for the way will once more take you along the land and sea of the fascinating island beginning with a cycling tour to reach the Akivi Taha . The scenic ride will take you to the seven moai standing on a platform. Yam and pineapple plantations will fill the air with sweet aromas combined with the slightly salty scent of the water. In the afternoon, you can dip into the waters of Rapa Nui once more with a snorkeling adventure. The crystal-clear sea will give you plenty of chances to find rainbow-colored coral, tropical fish, and strong mollusks.

dayInfo.title: Hanga Roa - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may share your favorite part of the island over breakfast, from the fantastic panoramic hike to watching the Kari Kari ballet that expresses traditional Polynesian culture through song and dance. You have traveled from the corner of northern Chile to one of the world’s most remote islands to find a remarkable connection and the distinct differences that shaped your captivating experience. After breakfast, you will transfer to Mataveri International Airport for your flight back to Santiago, where you will continue home.

tourName: Marvelous Luxuries of Chile Tour: Easter Island, Atacama, and Culture
placesVisited: Santiago (City), Easter Island, Valparaíso, Casablanca, Atacama Desert
generalInfo: Chile is drenched in cultural traditions and natural wonders that you will be ecstatic to explore on this lavish 12-day getaway starting in Santiago and leading to the Atacama Desert. Between the buzzing capital city’s enchanting cuisine, Easter Island’s spectacular seascape, and the Atacama Desert’s remarkable geothermal discoveries, every moment will share something special during your hand-picked tour to Chile’s captivating destinations.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - A Royal Arrival in Chile
dayInfo.description: Capital city and lifeblood of Chile, Santiago is a destination home to a huge portion of the Chilean population that fuses traditional cultural charm with modern appeal, blending it into a melting pot of heritage and contemporary characteristics. You will be delighted to have a free afternoon to discover Santiago at your own pace, losing yourself in the enchanting atmosphere that floods the cityscape. From the iconic museums peppering its skyline and chic restaurants serving the country’s finest renditions of classic culinary delicacies, moments of regal splendor will abound from the moment you step foot on Chilean soil.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island - Relishing Spectacles from the Top of Rano Kau
dayInfo.description: Rapa Nui, commonly known as Easter Island, is a remote volcanic island flung from the beaten path that welcomes eager visitors to its history-drenched shores for a retreat that is as educational as it is resplendent. From the minute you arrive, you will be treated to breathtaking vistas of a landscape left unspoiled and preserved in all its emerald allure, sweeping its forested topography and enormous craters. You will relish a slow stroll to the colossal volcano Rano Kau, shortly after arriving, to capture its spellbinding geological formation composed of a momentous crater hanging over a tranquil lake.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island - Awe-Inspiring Adventures across the Island
dayInfo.description: Easter Island is dripping with heritage spotlighted by iconic landmarks that sprinkle its topography. You will be absorbed from the get-go as you enjoy an immersive culture tour this beginning at Rano Raraku. Hosting a rocky quarry where the fabled Moai sculptures were carved, you will admire the astonishing artwork crafted by ancient Chilean communities before continuing to the immense Ahu Tongariki stone platform where 15 of the emblematic statues watch over the island. A local lunch alongside the turquoise waters hugging Anakena Beach and a visit to the staggering volcanic caves will conclude an adventurous day on the island.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island - Unrivaled Panoramas from Poike and Maunga Terevaka
dayInfo.description: Before the sun has risen above the horizon, you will gently climb the banks of Poike Hill to feel the first rays brush your cheeks from a summit overlooking the sprawling sea and rolling green hills. Your hike will continue up the steep slopes flanking Poike to the human-faced rock, Vai a Heva, etched into the precipice via natural erosion. In the afternoon, you may choose to ascend the soaring peak of Maunga Terevaka by foot or on horseback to cherish panoramic vistas of the island’s topography composed of rising and falling hills and a navy seascape enwreathing it.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Lapping Up the Luxuries of Santiago
dayInfo.description: You will step away from the island splendor of Easter Island today, after breakfast set to the enchanting seascape sunrise that will glimmer off of the calm waters. Arriving back in Santiago, the day is yours to enjoy as you please. Whether you wish to explore Chile’s emblematic artistic talent in the stylish galleries that dot the city or rise above the dazzling skyline for elegant cocktails served at a rooftop terrace, options abound. You can expect the best when you spend a day lapping up the luxuries of Santiago.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Culinary Exploration in the Heart of Chile
dayInfo.description: Though Santiago is a cosmopolitan city reflecting the influence of generations who have called this destination home, history is retained in the ancient architecture and insightful museums that fill its skyline. Today, after transferring back to your palatial accommodation poised in the heart of the city center, you will tour the stories lying beneath the modern facade. Introduce your taste buds to a series of exceptional Chilean dishes served at beloved eateries and award-winning restaurants alike. Along the way, you will connect with the locals and gain a deeper appreciation for Chile’s distinctive qualities.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Chilean Culture in Valparaíso and Casablanca
dayInfo.description: Santiago is but a stepping stone into Chilean culture, and today you will venture away from Santiago to immerse yourself in the traditions and distinct characteristics outside the buzzing cityscape. Starting in Valparaíso, you will catch a glimpse of the counterculture underpinning the cityscape dressed in colorful homes and splashed in evocative street art before arriving at the cascading green vineyards of the Casablanca wine valley. Visiting one of the most prestigious estates in the valley, you will select from a series of acclaimed vintages and discern the nuanced flavors of each eminent wine guided by a local sommelier.

dayInfo.title: Atacama Desert - Stargazing in a Sandy Paradise
dayInfo.description: A desert of remarkable beauty, composed of deep canyons carved into the coral sands and sprawling soft hills rising and fall into the distance, Atacama is a dreamy untouched haven that conserves the ancient origins of Chile’s forebears in the historic towns dotting its vast expanse. Today, you will transfer to a stunning desert resort sharing the antique stylings of the former sand homes in an opulent fashion fit for a king and queen. You may spend the afternoon soaking up the spectacular scenery and staring up at the twinkling stars shining brightly in the crystal clear sky.

dayInfo.title: Atacama Desert - Picture-Perfect Scenes of Snow, Yellows, and Greens
dayInfo.description: The Atacama Desert is a gateway to the incredible, unspoiled environments that spread across much of Chile’s greater landscape, and you will be besotted with the scenery shared today on your semi-private tour of the sparkling Miscanti and Meñiques lagoons. With views from atop a towering plateau nestled at the foothills of a looming powdery snow-capped mountain, that stark contrast of the whites, blues, and yellows culminate in a picturesque image worth a thousand words. Capture the great images before descending towards a rural village where you will learn more about the traditions of these outback communities.

dayInfo.title: Atacama Desert - Temperate Times in the Tatio Geysers
dayInfo.description: You will explore more of the bewildering environmental wonders that lay across Chile’s topography like a blanket of geological highlights, beginning with a visit to the Putana Wetlands circling the Putana Volcano. Take in the geothermal spectacles before you continue to the bubbling and erupting Tatio Geysers speckling the landscape between a steamy river where you may enjoy a balmy dip in its temperate waters and feel all of your stresses melt away. The idyllic setting, with the gentle breeze rolling off the mountains, will make for a peaceful escape from the rest of the world.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - A Welcoming Step to a Time Before Today
dayInfo.description: Take in the grandeur of the Atacama Desert as you tuck into delectable delights while the sun rises over lunar-looking Valle de la Luna and inundates it in a golden glow. You will treasure these phenomenal scenes before visiting a local tribe tucked away between the canyons, where life appears stuck in time. You will come to learn more about their timeless traditions as, translated by your knowledgeable guide, you communicate with the elders and share in their cultural heritage. You will travel to Santiago later today.

dayInfo.title: Santiago - Morning Moments at Your Own Pace
dayInfo.description: Like many cosmopolitan capitals, Santiago bursts to life even before the sun has risen as locals open up their fragrant food stalls, and travelers head out to grab a bite to eat. You may take the morning slow or get swept up by the local spirit, choosing to sip on a bold coffee and watch the world go by from your balcony or stepping outside to see the action from the streets. Either way, you will return home later today, having discovered the magic that Chile has to offer from Santiago to the Atacama Desert.

tourName: Outdoor Exploration Tour of Chile: Andes to the Pacific
placesVisited: Punta Arenas, San Pedro de Atacama, Atacama Desert, Santiago (City), Torres del Paine
generalInfo: On this 10-day tour of Chile, partake in the adventure of a lifetime in the great outdoors. From ice trekking through Patagonian ice fields and glaciers to sandboarding in the heart of the Atacama Desert, Chile is a thrill seeker’s paradise. Observe penguins in their natural habitat, spend the night glamping under thousands of stars, and traverse Torres del Paine National Park.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Arrive in Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at the airport, and your private driver will greet and transfer you to your marvelous accommodation in the heart of the city. You will have ample time to settle in to your suite before meeting your guide in the hotel lobby to begin your first explorations of Patagonia. You will transfer to the magnificent Mirador Cerro de la Cruz, where you can gaze out over stunning views of the many colorful buildings of Punta Arenas and the Strait of Magellan. Once the sun has fully set, you will be guided back into the center of Punta Arenas to delight in your first traditional Chilean meal.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Private Yacht Cruise
dayInfo.description: Today you will embark on a private yacht cruise through the Strait of Magellan. You will arrive at the incredible Magdalena Island, where you will be able to observe penguins in their natural habitat. As your cruise continues, you will be able to observe sea lions as they bask in the sun along the coast. You may even spot a group of dolphins and whales as you cruise through the gorgeous waters of Patagonia. In the evening, you will be returned to Punta Arenas. Depending on the season in which you are traveling, you may encounter the incredible Southern Hemisphere phenomenon where the sun does not set until nearly midnight, resulting in a seemingly endless day.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Scenic Mountain Trek
dayInfo.description: This morning you will transfer to an eco-friendly glampsite in Torres del Paine National Park. Once you arrive, you will begin to take in the sights and sounds of this gorgeous park before meeting your guide to begin your exploration of Patagonia’s top sites. You can choose your trek based on your personal interest and skill level. You will indulge in a trek to Mirador Los Cuernos, which is a leisurely hike to a marvelous glacial lagoon that is surrounded by towering mountains. In the evening, you will delight in a gourmet dinner at your glampsite before spending the night under an endless sky of stars.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Treasures of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will meet your private guide to begin your day’s adventure. Today, you will board your private coach and have an immersive tour of Patagonia’s most remarkable lookout points . Upon your arrival at your first lookout point, you will be stunned by the beauty of the three-peaked mountains that may be visible in the distance. In the afternoon, you can discuss your options for the rest of the day with your guide. As each tour is curated specifically to the guest, you will have the chance to select the activities that best suit your interests. You may go fishing, whitewater rafting, kayaking, horseback riding, or embark on another guided trek.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Ice Hiking on Grey Glacier
dayInfo.description: Today, you will cruise through the vast Patagonian ice fields, where you will delight in a guided ice trek on the Grey Glacier. From your glampsite, you will board a private transfer to the port to embark on your cruise through the glacial waters. Upon your arrival at the glacier, you will be stunned by its breathtaking magnitude. When you are ready, you will traverse the incredible expanse of Grey Glacier. At the conclusion of your ice trek, you will return to your opulent glampsite, where you can enjoy a delicious Chilean barbeque that will be accompanied by the country’s finest Cabernets.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Sandboarding in the Desert
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will transfer to the airport in Punta Arenas and board your flight to the Atacama Desert. Upon your arrival, your private driver will greet and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation. Once you have had time to relax, you will meet your guide in the lobby to begin your initial explorations of the Atacama Desert. To begin, you will transfer to the heart of the desert, where you will encounter sand dunes that seem to reach up to the sky. You will be able to partake in sandboarding, which is a newly popularized Chilean activity. When you are ready, you can cruise down the slopes of the dunes on your sandboard. In the evening, you will delight in a stargazing tour beneath the desert sky.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Valle de la Luna
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will continue your exploration of the Atacama Desert. In the morning, you can partake in a private cycling tour through the desert’s most noteworthy sites and destinations. As the afternoon presses on, you will embark on a tour of the stunning Moon Valley. During your time here, you will meander through the valley and visit the area’s incredible landforms. As the sun begins to fade, you will be transferred to a gorgeous lookout point, where you will watch the sunset over the vast terrain of the valley. You will have the remainder of the day to wander through the charming town.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Cerro San Cristobal
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to Santiago. Upon your arrival in the Chilean capital city, your private driver will greet and transfer you to your luxurious hotel in the charming Lastarria neighborhood of Santiago. After you have had a moment to settle in, you will meet your guide in the lobby to begin exploring this remarkable city. You will begin the day with a customized tour of Santiago’s top sites and destinations. Your tour will include visits to the Lastarria neighborhood, the Bellavista area, and La Chascona, which is the home of Pablo Neruda.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Valparaiso and Viña del Mar
dayInfo.description: Today, you will explore the neighboring cities of Valparaiso and Viña del Mar on a full-day excursion from Santiago. After a short transfer, you will arrive in the marvelous port city of Valparaiso. Upon your arrival, you will ascend to the top of the gorgeous Cerro Alegre, where you have spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean. You can also stroll through the town’s enchanting streets and pick up a souvenir or two. Upon your arrival in Viña del Mar, your guide will offer you a tour of the area’s noteworthy sites before leaving you to enjoy the rest of the afternoon at your leisure. When you are ready, you will return to Santiago.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy your final breakfast in Chile. You can spend your final morning in Santiago exploring at your leisure. Soon, your driver will transfer you to the airport for your

tourName: Patagonia Adventure Tour: Thrilling Activities, Serene Nature, Marvelous Luxuries
placesVisited: Patagonia, San Martín de los Andes, Puerto Fuy, Junín de Los Andes, Villa la Angostura, Bariloche
generalInfo: Composed of verdant forests, crystalline lakes, and soaring mountain peaks, Argentina and Chile’s Patagonian regions are yours to adventure within on this action-packed 12-day tour across the lake district of Patagonia. From the bewitching woodlands of San Martín de Los Andes to the marvelous shorelines of Bariloche, discover what makes South America’s picturesque Patagonian lands one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.

dayInfo.title: San Martín de Los Andes - Picturesque Images of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: Closing in on Patagonia, you will catch a glimpse of Argentina’s soaring snow-capped mountains from your plane, a sight you will soon admire up close after landing and transferring to your accommodation nestled in the charming town of San Martín de Los Andes. Today, you will join your guide for a mountain biking tour of the surrounding region, cycling through the overgrown Araucaria Forest to the base of the colossal Lonquimay Volcano. With dramatic spectacles of the mountains and rolling emerald landscape backdropping your ride, you will be at a loss for words on your first day in Argentina.

dayInfo.title: San Martín de Los Andes - Cruising through Conguillio National Park
dayInfo.description: You will see more of Patagonia by bicycle today as you enjoy a full day cycling tour from your accommodation after breakfast. You will enter the luxuriant Conguillio National Park and whizz across its charcoal gravel paths to the foot of Llaima Volcano, before continuing beneath the shaded viridian canopy en route to the quaint village of Melipeuco. During the trip, you will have plenty of opportunities to hop off your bikes and inspect the flourishing flora blooming between the thicket and witness the fascinating animals that reside within this diverse forest ecosystem.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Fuy - Whisked Away to Chile
dayInfo.description: You will enjoy a deserved break from the arduous gravel roads today as you cycle from Argentina, through the Chilean border, downhill towards a stunning private resort hemmed into the proliferating forests of Panguipulli in Chile’s Patagonian Forest. With access to a divine spa on-site and scenes of the staggering unspoiled wildlife circling your accommodation, you will luxuriate in the splendors of this great retreat. You may partake in a light stroll around the grounds to acclimate to the atmosphere of the forest before tucking into a sumptuous supper later this evening.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Fuy - Living Wild in the Forests of Panguipulli
dayInfo.description: The untouched nature reserve enwreathing your accommodation is yours to explore at your pace today, whether slowly wandering through the shamrock-colored forest or finding refuge beneath the gushing waterfalls that flow over its craggy cliffs. All the while, you will capture images of the native creatures waddling through the forest as leaves drop from the trees and birds hop from branch to branch, whistling melodic songs to soundtrack your day discovering more of Panguipulli. You may take a swim in the natural pool formed at the foot of the waterfall before returning to your resort later in the day.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - Cabin in the Wilds
dayInfo.description: You will return to Argentina today, this time crossing the border stationed on the other end of Lake Pirihueico after a short ferry trip across its sparkling waters. Your guide and bikes await your arrival on the other side of customs, and you will hop on for a delightful trip along the coast of Lake Lacar. The glimmering lake and towering mountains will surround the paths on which you ride, ushering you closer with each passing minute to your spectacular cabin built on the banks of the Chimehuin River Valley with a commanding view of Lanin Volcano.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - Stars Lighting Up Nahuel Mapi Canyon
dayInfo.description: After a short drive, you will arrive at a meeting point where you will be greeted by your guide accompanied by horses. You will mount up and head for the hills, trotting along flower-dotted fields beneath the looming mountains. Marvelous rock formations litter the Alumine River Valley and the crest of Lanin Volcano overlooks your trails, a brilliant backdrop for your journey to your campsite stationed in Nahuel Mapi Canyon. You may crack open a cold beverage upon arrival and share stories around the campfire as the sunset burns the sky orange and the stars twinkle from above.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - The Wooded Landscape of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will ride further up the Nahuel Mapi Canyon today, passing through the Patagonian woodlands beneath the breathtaking Andes Mountains, towards crystal clear lakes and balmy springs peppering this idyllic wilderness paradise. Arriving at the banks of one of the lakes veiling the landscape, you may relish a vitalizing dip in the refreshing waters before tucking into a delectable picnic lunch and continuing to lofty mountain peaks where the postcard-perfect scenes of Patagonia stretch off to meet the horizon. Every inch of this dreamy destination will be something to behold.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - Drifting along the Seven Lakes Road
dayInfo.description: Your travels deeper into Patagonia will begin this morning, as you set course for the bendy avenues of the Seven Lakes Road, given its nickname as it weaves past the coast of several mesmerizing lakes, including Espejo, Correntoso, Escondido, Falkner, Villarino, Machonico, and Lacar. The adventure, revealing alluring scenes of the spectacular lakeside environments, will lead you to Villa la Angostura, where you will check into a charming resort tucked away in the forests spreading in all directions beneath the Andes.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - Sunny Moments on the Crystal Shores
dayInfo.description: You will head out from town this morning to the banks of Lake Espejo, hopping into a kayak with professional equipment and paddling out across the crystalline waters to take in the scenic splendors from a unique vantage point. You will cross to the mouth of a river that connects Lake Espejo Chico to Lake Espejo, the ideal spot to dive into the water on a snorkeling excursion to see what lives below the surface. You may also fly-fish from the softy, velvety shores of a nearby beach before paddling back to your vehicle and making your way back home.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - One Last Paddle across Lake Espejo
dayInfo.description: Today, you will lap up more of the luxurious scenery by kayak as you paddle further across Lake Espejo, this time gliding in new directions to see what else lies along its shimmering coast. You will stumble upon hideaway beaches where you may find refuge beneath the shade of trees hugging the shore and jump off between the thicket to capture images of dazzling birds soaring overhead and catch the wafts of fragrant flowers blossoming from behind the dense vegetation.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Untouched Woodlands of Arrayanes National Park
dayInfo.description: You will leave the beautiful Villa La Angostura by private boat this morning, sailing across the shimmering sapphire water of Nahuel Huapi Lake towards Arrayanes National Park. Hopping off of the boat, you will begin your stroll through the forested grounds speckled with millennial trees and teeming with colorful creatures. Viewpoints positioned across Anchorena Port will share the remarkable scenery en route to the soft sands of the sun-soaked beaches, before you arrive at Bariloche port for an evening spent on the woodland-fringed shores of Lake Nahuel Huapí.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Birdsong Brings Your Journey to a Close
dayInfo.description: The sunshine will glimmer off of the crystalline lake as birdsong signals the beginning of your final few hours in South America. Sipping on a bold brew of coffee, you may watch the morning slowly breeze by from your balcony before savoring your last breakfast at your accommodation. With many memories of your thrilling adventures across Argentina and Chile made during your tour, you will return feeling completely besotted with the wonders of this part of the world. Shortly after breakfast, you will join your private transfer and make your way to the international airport.

tourName: Romantic 10-Day Getaway to Chile: Cities, Mountains & Beaches
placesVisited: Santiago (City), San Pedro de Atacama, Iquique
generalInfo: On this 10-day tour of Chile, experience the best of the country’s most romantic destinations in complete luxury. From the gorgeous beaches of Iquique’s Pacific Coast to the vast beauty of the Atacama Desert, Chile is the perfect destination for a romantic getaway. Attend a riveting Chilean cultural performance accompanied by a traditional gourmet dinner, sip on the country’s finest vintages in the Maipo Valley, indulge in a hot air balloon ride over the Atacama Desert.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Cultural Show with Dinner
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at the airport in Santiago, and your private driver will greet and transfer you to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of the Lastarria neighborhood. You will be captivated by the distinctive Latin feel of the city as you ride through the city. After you have had time to settle in, you will meet your driver in the lobby to begin your first official tour of Santiago. Today, you will attend a traditional Chilean cultural performance of song and dance that will be accompanied by dinner. After dinner, you will have the chance to experience Santiago’s infamous nightlife.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Santiago’s Top Sites
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will lead you on a tour of the city. The tour will also be customized to your interests. Therefore, no two tours are ever identical. Your tour may begin in the trendy Bellavista neighborhood, where you and your partner can stroll through the streets and admire the variety of unique street art that lines the colorful buildings. Soon, you will arrive in the historic neighborhood of Lastarria. In the afternoon, you will have your choice of touring one of Santiago’s finest museums. These can include the Chilean Museum of Pre-Columbian Art or the Museum of Memory and Human Rights.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Cerro San Cristobal
dayInfo.description: You will begin your day with one of Santiago’s most iconic attractions: Cerro San Cristobal. After breakfast, you will board the city’s famed funicular and ascend to the summit of the hill. From the top, you can admire spectacular views of the entire city of Santiago and the snow-capped Andes Mountains. Your tour will allow you to explore more of this incredible landscape. Soon, you will be led to a clearing, where a romantic picnic will have been set out for you and your partner. When you are ready, you will descend from Cerro San Cristobal and have the rest of the afternoon to explore Santiago at your leisure. In the evening, your guide will lead you to the top of Santa Lucia Hill.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Valparaiso and Viña del Mar
dayInfo.description: Today, you will embark on a full-day excursion to the city of Valparaiso and the town of Viña del Mar. To reach these enclaves, you will board your private coach for a quick transfer to the port city of Valparaiso. Upon your arrival, your guide will lead you on a tour of the city’s most significant sites. Once you have had some time to explore on your own, you will transfer to the oceanside town of Viña del Mar. Upon your arrival, your guide will lead you on a quick tour of the area’s noteworthy sites, including the infamous Flower Clock, before leaving you to relax on the beach.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Romantic Winery Tour
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will transfer to the Maipo Valley, which is Chile’s top wine region. You will arrive at your opulent accommodation, where you will have some time to relax and settle in to your new surroundings. When you are ready, you can meet your guide to begin your official exploration of this incredible region. You will begin your explorations of the Maipo Valley with a tour of the area’s top wineries. During your tour, you will have the exclusive opportunity to meet the winemakers. In the afternoon, you and your companion will partake in a marvelous wine tasting of the region’s highest-quality vintages.

dayInfo.title: Maipo Valley – Natural Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can indulge in a leisurely trek through the Maipo Valley. At the conclusion of your hike, you will be transferred to some natural hot springs. You and your partner can relax with an afternoon spent enjoying this natural phenomenon. During your dip in the healing waters of the spa, you will be offered a delicious array of regional wine and cheese. When you are ready, you can transfer to your accommodation and spend the rest of the day at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Desert Stargazing
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to the Atacama Desert. Upon your arrival, your private driver will greet and transfer you to your luxurious ecolodge and spa accommodation in the heart of San Pedro de Atacama. Once you have had sufficient time to freshen up, you will partake in a bike tour through the vast Atacama Desert that will have you stopping at the region’s most significant sites. In the evening, your guide will lead you on a tour of the Moon Valley, which has been named for its likeness to the moon’s surface.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Hot Air Balloon Ride
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have a hot air balloon ride at sunrise. Your hot air balloon will slowly ascend to the sky, providing you with extraordinary views of the boundless Atacama Desert. Once your ride has concluded, you will enjoy breakfast before transferring to the sand dunes of the Atacama. Upon your arrival, you will partake in a sandboarding experience. Once you have had your fill of sandboarding, you will have the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Iquique – Relax on Playa Cavancha
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to the beachside city of Iquique. Known for being a popular Chilean vacation destination, Iquique is the perfect place to end your trip to Chile. When you arrive, your driver will transfer you to your accommodation, where you can have some time to relax. When you are ready, your guide will lead you on a brief tour of Iquique’s historic city center before transferring you to the Playa Cavancha beach. You can spend the afternoon relaxing on the beach and enjoying your final day in Chile. In the evening, your guide can provide you with excellent dining recommendations.

dayInfo.title: Iquique – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy your final breakfast in Chile before having the morning to spend at your leisure. Soon, you will transfer to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Santiago and Buenos Aires: Wine and Tango Tour
placesVisited: Santiago, Buenos Aires
generalInfo: From the brightly colored homes of La Boca to the ponderous history of the Plaza de Armas, from the romance of the gauchos, to the resplendence of a Chilean Cabernet, this is a wine and tango tour that will tease all of your senses and ignite your dreams. The Andes beckon you, and the Avenida 9 de Julio is calling out for you to visit. With all of the grandeur of a Chile and Argentina tour waiting, why would you ever say no?

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Arriving in the Capital of Chile
dayInfo.description: This morning, you cross over the craggy Andes Mountains and land on the outskirts of scintillating Santiago, Chile’s captivating capital and one of the great cities of South America. A driver will be waiting for you at the airport, and will transfer you to your luxurious accommodations in the heart of this incredible city, where the staff is warm and welcoming, and the amenities are truly second to none. Spend the morning recovering from your overnight flight, then head out to explore the city with an expert guide, hitting all of Santiago’s varied highlights. You’ll be amazed by the ornate façade of the splendid La Moneda Palace, a masterpiece of neoclassical architecture. You’ll be inspired by the newly constructed Plaza de la Ciudadania, the beautiful public square that fronts La Moneda and offers many stirring monuments to the political greats from Chile’s long and illustrious history. Then turn to the Plaza de Armas, the social, cultural and spiritual heart of Santiago, where you’ll encounter some of the finest examples of architecture the city has to offer. Here you’ll find the impressive and inspirational Metropolitan Cathedral of Santiago – the seat of the Archbishop of Santiago – the Central Post Office Building that looks like it was lifted from the streets of turn-of-the-century Paris, and the fascinating Palacio de la Real Audiencia de Santiago, which houses the excellent National History Museum of Chile. Later this afternoon, you’ll make your way to the greener parts of Santiago, offering an amazing look at the diversity of this marvelous metropolis. Enjoy a gentle stroll through the Parque Forestal, noted for its triple line of Oriental plane trees and for the fine museums that can be found here, including two of Chile’s best art museums. Venture into the charming neighborhood of Bellavista, where you’ll find La Chascona , the Santiago house of Chile’s most famous poet, Pablo Neruda, as well as a wide assortment of boutiques, restaurants, and cutting-edge art galleries. A climb up nearby San Cristobal Hill offers a sensational view over the city, and a visit to the village of Los Graneros del Alba is sure to be the perfect end to this stirring tour of Santiago. See what else our top Chile travel specialists can do for you on your custom Chile vacation.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Exploring the Famed Vina Concha y Toro
dayInfo.description: Today, you’ll experience the best-known and best-loved name in all of Chilean wine as you venture to the vineyards of the renowned winemaker Vina Concha y Toro, a winery with more than a century of history. Stretching across all of Chile’s greatest wine regions, Vina Concha y Toro is the largest wine producer in all of Latin America and an undisputed global leader in New World wines, producing deep, sumptuous reds and crisp, clean whites that are sure to leave your taste buds buzzing. This day-long tour will show you the best sights of Chile’s up-and-coming wine business, where the growing climate combines the best of France and California and where the grapevines are not susceptible to some of the devastating diseases that plague them in other, more established wine growing regions. An expert oenophile will show you how the latest technology combined with time-honored techniques produce wine that is fragrant on the nose, light on the palate and simply sensational from the first glass to the last. Take in some of the fascinating history of winemaking in Chile – a history that stretches back some four centuries – before sampling the vineyard’s best vintages and varietals, from the buttery sweetness of their Chardonnay to the bold tannins of their irresistible Cabernet Sauvignon.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – The Bourgeoning Wineries of Santa Cruz
dayInfo.description: Head further afield as you turn to the heart of the Colchagua Valley, one of the best wine growing regions in Chile and the region where you’ll find the quaint and delightful city of Santa Cruz, where the rural traditions of Chile continue much as they have for centuries. On your way out, you’ll pass by some of the area’s greatest wineries, getting a chance to learn about the peculiarities of growing grapes in this unique climate as well as an opportunity to taste more of the products of the country’s most talented winemakers. The wine is not the only attraction; you’ll sample fresh local cheeses, delicious nuts, and other accompaniments, and even get a glimpse of Chilean folk culture with an intimate concert from a local folk singer who will regale you with the ditties and ballads of this charming country. The day concludes with a visit to one of Santa Cruz’s many wineries, where tradition still holds a powerful sway and where the echoes of the past seem to haunt the air. Your last stop is sure to be your favorite, as you’ll be enchanted by the many wonders of Santa Cruz, from its colonial Plaza de Armas to the interesting exhibits at the Museum of Colchagua, where artifacts from centuries of Chilean history, art and culture are all on display. The evening sees you back in Santiago, ready for one more evening of fun. You might want to check out one of the city’s notorious jazz clubs, which attract local, national and international talent from a variety of genres, from swing to free jazz to blues to bossa nova.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Fly to Breathtaking Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Prepare your passport and ready yourself for a voyage west as you leave the seaside air and the Andean backdrop of Santiago for the rolling rivers of the Rio de la Plata, bound for bountiful Buenos Aires. Once you touch down, a private driver will be waiting to take you to your elegant hotel, situated in the heart of this bustling capital, and offering an incredible introduction to Buenos Aires’s undeniable allure. This evening, enjoy a traditional asado (roast) of some of the finest cuts of steak you’re ever likely to try.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – The Best of Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: After a leisurely morning, turn to the streets of Buenos Aires for a first-hand experience of the pulsing energy that makes the city one of the very best in South America. Start at the city’s celebrated center, where the Plaza de Mayo marks ground zero for Argentine activism and where the surrounding buildings reflect the cultures and traditions of this immigrant-rich city. From the local pink marble of the famed Casa Rosada – Argentina’s executive mansion – to the belle-epoque styling of Buenos Aires’s City Hall, to the colonial echoes of the Buenos Aires Cabildo, it will be impossible to ignore the rich and varied past that this inimitable world capital has seen over the centuries. Continue on and explore the wealthier barrios of Buenos Aires, the neighborhoods where nobility and political bigwigs have lived for centuries. From the tree-lined avenues and cobblestone streets of San Telmo to the beauty of Palermo, to the elegant and opulent cemetery of La Recoleta, one of the most beautiful of its kind and the final resting place for a number of Argentine legends, including the famous First Lady Evita Peron. Then turn to the livelier districts of Buenos Aires, where the working classes developed their own culture and traditions. From the brightly-colored houses and storefronts of La Boca – highlighted by the inestimable street scene of La Caminita – to the newly restored and refurbished Puerto Madero, the waterfront area that features some of the latest architectural trends in the city.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – The Life of the Argentine Cowboy
dayInfo.description: Leave the hectic environment of Buenos Aires and turn to the countryside, where you’ll get an opportunity to live the life of the gallant gauchos , those timeless residents of the Pampas that have exerted such a strong hold on Argentina’s nationalist sentiments. Your day with these rugged cowboys will include a lesson on the day-to-day lives and experiences of these romantic figures, an exposition of their fine horse riding skills, and a delicious asado in the traditional fashion, where the open flame imparts a delicious taste to some of the freshest meat you can imagine. You’ll be sure to love the stories and songs of the Argentine plains, and you’ll be fascinated by the history and traditions of the people that have called them home for centuries. The evening sees you back in Buenos Aires.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – The Magic and Majesty of the Paris of Latin America
dayInfo.description: Your last full day in South America is spent enjoying the many charms of Buenos Aires, from its astounding architecture to its world-class culture. Perambulate down the sprawling Avenida 9 de Julio, the world’s widest avenue, and take in the beautiful buildings that line the street on either side, like the famed Teatro Colon, Argentina’s national opera house and one of the five best acoustic venues on the planet. Continue on to the heart of the city to take in the impressive Obelisk before engaging in some retail therapy in one of Buenos Aires’s excellent shopping areas. Fine leather goods – a hallmark of Argentine fashion – can be found throughout the city, but perhaps the best place to find them is on Murillo Street, where you’ll encounter everything from handbags to coats to handmade shoes. Florida Street and Lavalle Street are the best places to find tourist items like the mate or high-quality tango shoes, and since they’re pedestrian-only streets, they often have a good street performance going on, especially after the sun goes down. The evening concludes in high style, as you make your way to one of the city’s phenomenal tango clubs. You’ll feel the heat of the passion and romance that goes into every step of this noteworthy national dance, all while enjoying the finest in Argentine beef and wine. It is truly an evening that dreams are made of, and an experience that you are sure never to forget. If you would like to explore more of Argentina, be sure to visit the Argentina tours section on Zicasso. Also, see the Argentina trip reviews from travelers.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Adios, South America
dayInfo.description: Today, you prepare to return home, as a driver will take you to the airport in plenty of time to board your plane. You’ll be sure to have the ringing lilt of Southern Cone Spanish ringing in your ears, the folk songs of Chile and the Pampas filling your ears, and the undeniable magic and romance of these two fantastic countries filling your heart. The only thing you’ll be regretting when the plane leaves the ground is that you have to leave.

tourName: South America's Finest Vineyards Tour of Chile, Uruguay, Argentina
placesVisited: Santiago, Valparaiso, Mendoza, Buenos Aires, Colonia del Sacramento
generalInfo: From the aroma of decadent chocolate emanating from a boutique confectionary to finding subtle hints of dark cherry and plum in a sip of wine, your custom tailored tour of Chile, Argentina, and Uruguay provides the perfect journey for oenophiles and culinary connoisseurs alike. Stroll among rows of vines with views of the snowcapped Andean peaks. Delight in cobblestone streets and colonial architecture. View colorful houses draping over steep hills and tango dancers performing in the open-air. Take pleasure in leisurely lifestyles, sample culture, revel in charm, and relish the refined, unique flavors of Chile, Argentina, and Uruguay.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Sampling a Chilean Introduction
dayInfo.description: Santiago has a fascinating blend of cosmopolitan ambiance, sophisticated streets, elegant artistry, and passionate locals. Tall, thick trees shade the boulevards and cobblestones line the older streets leading to the steps along Cerro San Cristobal. In the morning, the Central Market brims with vendors showcasing their fresh-caught seafood, from sea bass to mussels, and the neighboring outdoor produce market bustles with locals eager to sample ripening passion fruit and crimson strawberries. Your flight lands at Comodoro Arturo Merino Benitez International Airport, where your private transfer greets you upon your arrival. Settle into the comforts of your luxurious hotel in the artistic neighborhood of Lastarria. Bohemian coffee shops fill the streets with the aroma of roasting coffee beans. The Archaeological Museum of Santiago frames Plaza Mulato Gil de Castro. The galleries showcase cultural artifacts from around the country, including hats, baskets, and jewelry, some dating back as far as 1,000 BC. For a perfect introduction to Santiago and the Chilean culture, you make your way to Bocanáriz. The relaxed ambiance and specialty wine selection offer one of the best culinary experiences in the city. Brick walls and wooden tables help accentuate the atmosphere as the dining room fills with the aroma of slow-roasted meats, zesty dressings, and an array of gold, rosy, and dark purple hues from the wine glasses decorating the tables.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – In the Interest of the Vine
dayInfo.description: The doors of local café along the main avenue of Providencia open to the irresistible aroma of fresh coffee. Baristas serve an array of café con leche and blends of beans from across South America, showcasing an artisanal knowledge in the craft of blending, brewing, and serving. Your guide greets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to the vine-covered hills of the Casablanca Valley. The cool climate and mixture of hills, valley, and sea offer vibrant mineral-rich soils in which the grapes grow. The Pacific Ocean provides a refreshing breeze throughout the year. The hills protect the valley from shifting drastically in temperature, providing a Mediterranean climate. The leaves rustling along the vines shimmer with emerald and jade hues. Spanish colonial style manors rise out of the sea of vineyards. You arrive at your first winery spread over the hills at the entrance to the valley. Your guide leads you along the vines where you touch your fingers to the plump and waxy texture of the growing grapes. The leaves feel coarse and firm. The vineyard focuses on producing white wines, utilizing the various sections of the landscape to add richness in flavor, body, or both. In the tasting room, your guide pours a sample of the Chardonnay. A hint of pineapple emanates from the golden hues of the glass, giving way to a buttery texture on your palate.

dayInfo.title: Valparaiso – Along the Coastal Hills
dayInfo.description: The morning commuters of Santiago wander amongst the artistic creations decorating the metro stations around the city. The most elegant character of the Universidad de Chile derives from the unique murals adorning the upper walls. The contemporary work blending modern and art nouveau style depicts the history of Chile, choosing to portray the arch of history in glory and tumult. After breakfast, your private transfer greets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to the coastline to visit the sister cities of Valparaiso and Viña del Mar, before crossing into Argentina. Valparaiso offers a unique panorama of the past with vintage funiculars continuing to traverse the steep hills amongst colorful homes overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The port neighborhood remains popular with artists, poets, and students who gain inspiration from the mixture of obvious charm and hidden wonder. Stairways weave through the interconnected streets and renovated mansions harkening back to a more glamorous time along the seaside. One of the most famous buildings in the city is La Sebastiana, the former seaside home of Chilean poet Pablo Neruda. The white and red exterior glistens atop the hillside with a view of the water, with large windows allowing the breeze to carry the aroma of the briny water. The interior contains copious imagery of sea life and hidden passageways the poet utilized during house parties.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Chocolates and Grounds
dayInfo.description: Mendoza is a city of quality and charm situated near the lush vineyards spreading over the Uco Valley. The Andean peaks create small silhouettes against the western horizon amongst the aromas of decadent chocolate emanating from the countless chocolateries dotting the wide cobbled boulevards and narrow, quiet avenues. Your guide greets you after breakfast, eager to lead you on a half-day tour of the city’s continued colonial charms. Fountains trickle with water at the center of public plazas. Cafes and restaurants set out tables and chairs along the walkways for patrons to enjoy the refreshing breeze and participate in people watching. You can hear gurgling water throughout the city from the irrigation ditches running alongside the sidewalks and main roads. The relaxed ambiance easily welcomes you to the beauty of the city and the accepting culture of the locals. For a grand introduction and easy orientation to Mendoza, your guide leads you to the Terraza Mirador, a rooftop terrace adorning City Hall. Statues frame the edges of the tiled terrace. You can view the skyline soaring over the treetops and streets, imitating the rolling Andean peaks. In the afternoon, you meet a private chef well known in the Mendoza culinary world for a lesson in traditional regional Argentinian cuisine. Your instructor goes over more than just the ingredients and their preparation, but also the connection of the food to culture, and the importance of those ingredients to Mendoza. The aroma of roasting meat emanates from the barbecue pit. The scent of garlic accompanies creamy olive oil. You savor the aromas as you wait for the traditional empanadas stuffed with mushrooms and onions.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Pleasures of the Valley
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide greets you after breakfast and leads you away from the city streets to enjoy the sprawling vines and distinct flavors of the Uco Valley. The irrigation ditches you noticed around the city continue through the valley, helping source water around the desert landscape. The looming peaks of the Andes continue to texture the western horizon. The valley contains more than 1,500 wineries, combining the greenery of the vines, the rugged majesty of the Andes, and the open blue splendor of the sky. You make your way to the heart of the valley to reach a vineyard known as much for its grand architecture as for the wines produced. The winery blends Old World and New World techniques to provide vibrant, unique flavors paying tribute to the valley’s soil. The manor was designed in the shape of a cross with vines filling the air with a herbaceous and sweet aroma. In the cellar, you find 5,000 oak barrels stacked beneath the vaulted ceilings. Your guide’s footsteps echo against the stone of the cellar. The treasured acoustics have given the cellar a second use as a performance space. In the tasting room, your guide pours an array of samples. You are particularly excited about trying the Pinot Noir, one of the wines for which the vineyard is known. You discover an aroma of ripe cherries and blackberries emanating from the glass. The burgundy hue gives way to youthful, soft body with a pleasant, lingering finish.

dayInfo.title: Colonia – To the Heart of Uruguay
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of chocolate returns to the streets of Mendoza. The chocolatiers work the dark, milk, and even white chocolate to great effect, producing masterful truffles, stunning shells, and captivating statuettes to place in the display windows around the city center. Your private transfer meets you at the hotel lobby after breakfast and escorts you to Governor Francisco Gabrielli International Airport for your flight to Montevideo, Uruguay. The capital city contains a vibrant and eclectic atmosphere at the mouth of the Uruguay River north of the Rio de la Plata. Neoclassical buildings wind beneath the shadows of skyscrapers, and the popular riverbank promenade fills with music at all hours of the day. Antique theaters decorate the walkways, and tango bars provide a sense of the city’s evening movement. Your guide greets you at Aeropuerto de Carrasco for an introductory tour of the capital city streets. Wander along La Rambla, a 10-mile long boulevard separating the city from the waters of the Atlantic Ocean. The sea breeze carries over the artistic walkway as locals enjoy the view to passing boats. The aroma of vibrant strawberries fades beneath the enticing scent of grilled fish drizzled with lime, emanating from the stalls of Mercado del Puerto. You continue to the charming town of Colonia to reach your resort-style accommodation blending tranquil ambiance with colonial décor and modern comfort.

dayInfo.title: Colonia – On the Banks of Rio de la Plata
dayInfo.description: The town of Colonia retains its colonial charm at the heart of the historic district. Narrow cobbled streets and whitewashed walls harken back to the days of the Portuguese settlers before the Spanish overtook the town. The scent of freshwater and sycamore trees provide refreshment from the expanding sunlight. You make your way out of the town for the day to explore the gorgeous countryside, beginning with the Estancia Anchorena, one of the oldest wineries in the country. The ranch covers nearly three and a half acres with the main house originally erected in the early 20th century. The half-timber home and red-tiled rooftop resemble a structure out of Switzerland. Today the manor acts as the presidential summer palace. Trees from around the world help shade the grounds of the park, including an array of eucalyptus, which offer an aroma of black licorice to the air. You continue to another winery in the area first established in the mid-19th century by German settlers. The vineyards encompass more than 110 acres and have a collection of preserved buildings first erected in the late 19th century, reflecting the character of the past and the traditions of the vineyard. Enter into the cellar to experience the shift in temperature to a refreshing cool. You sample a rose blend of Cabernet and Tannat, finding an aroma of cherry fresh cherry and black licorice.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – History Crossing Borders
dayInfo.description: The morning breeze rushes over the waters of the Rio de la Plata and carries a revitalizing temperature. The sycamore trees rustle over the cobbled streets of the historic center. The aroma of coffee adds to the charm and enriching scent of the aged stone around town. Your guide greets you after breakfast, ready to lead you through the layers of Colonia del Sacramento’s history, beginning along the antique wall more than 200 years old. The city lighthouse overlooks the water and was originally constructed in the mid-19th century. Whitewashed colonial buildings shimmer beneath the sunlight as you follow in the footsteps of the Portuguese for insight into the region’s first European settlers. Iglesia Matriz is the oldest church in Uruguay and was established in the late 17th century. The symmetrical walls and spires act as the centerpiece of the Plaza de Armas, which also stands on the foundations laid by the Portuguese. The Portuguese Museum displays artifacts representing the luster of the more prominent settlers, from porcelain to antique furniture, along the utilized maps of the river and the Atlantic Ocean. Colonia has preserved its charm and continues to allure with colonial elegance. You make your way to the port along the riverside and board a ferry in the afternoon bound for Buenos Aires, Argentina.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Flavor of the City
dayInfo.description: The Old World elegance and New World luster provide Buenos Aires with an ambiance all of its own. Sycamore trees shade the graceful cobbled boulevards of Recoleta, a neighborhood known for mansions and prestige. Antique markets and shops spill into the plazas of San Telmo throughout the week, offering insight into the past and present aesthetics of locals, from clothing to coveted woodwork made on nearby estancias. Your guide greets you in the hotel lobby ready to lead you through the marvels of the city dating back to the 16th century along the foundations of the Plaza de Mayo. Cafes set out tables and chairs alongside the busy pedestrian promenades. Locals indulge in strong coffee in the morning and fresh churros coated with cinnamon and sugar. In the afternoon, restaurants fill the air with slowly roasting meats, accentuated by the scents of garlic and chili flakes mixed for chimichurri . Your guide leads you down the colorful street of El Caminito in the La Boca district. Brightly painted corrugated homes line the pedestrian avenue. Locals watch passersby from their windows. Artists capture the movement and color on canvas amongst the displayed photos of Eva Perón and Che Guevara. Tango dancers move in step with their own rhythm and pose for photos. The barrio gives an undeniable flair and flavor to the city.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Taking to the Tastes
dayInfo.description: Cafes and bakeries display freshly made empanadas in their windows. The aroma of buttery and flaky dough fills the streets around Calle Florida. The day is yours before your flight to continue your exploration of the city or venture to an estancia on the outskirt of Buenos Aires to experience the daily life of an Argentine gaucho. The sweet aroma of dulce de leche fills the air outside of a celebrated ice cream shop. The boutique shop opened in the 1950s along Avenida Corrientes and continues to satiate the desires of the city late at night with the renowned dulce de leche flavor. The smooth texture and balanced taste have charmed patrons from around the world. Stay for a sample or partake in an ice cream tour before your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to Ministro Pistarini International Airport.

tourName: Stepping into Chile’s History: 10-Day Chilean Excursion
placesVisited: Easter Island, San Pedro de Atacama, Santiago, Valparaíso
generalInfo: On this historically based 10-day adventure through Chile, you will uncover much of the history of this cultural wonderland. From the enigmatic stone statues of Easter Island to the colorful streets of Valparaiso, Chile is known as a country that is steeped in history and culture. Gaze up at the night sky with endless stars in the Atacama Desert, admire panoramic views of Santiago and the gorgeous Andes Mountains, and trek through Easter Island’s volcanic hills.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island – Enjoy a Cultural Performance
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at the airport on Easter Island, where you will be met by your private driver and transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of Hanga Roa. Upon your arrival, you will have time to settle in to your elegant suite and freshen up before exploring the town and Anakena Beach on your own. In the evening, you will meet your personal guide in the hotel lobby to begin your first cultural exploration of your vacation. Your first evening on Easter Island will begin with a cultural performance of traditional Rapa Nui song and dance that will be accompanied by a gourmet meal of local delicacies and Chilean wine.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island – Sunrise at Ahu Tongariki
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have an early morning and breakfast at your hotel before meeting your private driver in the lobby to embark on your first full day on Easter Island. You will arrive at Ahu Tongariki just in time to watch the sunrise. Once you have had your fill of Ahu Tongariki, you will continue on a tour of Easter Island’s most noteworthy sights and destinations. During your tour, you will visit the illustrious Rano Raraku National Park, which is the site of the island’s main Moai quarry and where you will explore the park to learn more about these unique, stone-faced statues. In the evening, you will be returned to Hanga Roa.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island – Snorkeling and Diving
dayInfo.description: Today, you will be exploring the Pacific Ocean during a snorkeling or scuba diving adventure. During your exploration, you will have the opportunity to swim through gorgeous sea caves and to admire the marine wildlife that exists in the area. In the afternoon, you will be led to the extraordinary Anakena Beach, where you will spend the remainder of the afternoon at your leisure. There are plenty of water-based activities that are available on the beach if you and your travel companions are feeling adventurous today.

dayInfo.title: Easter Island – Private Island Tour
dayInfo.description: Today, you will indulge in an incredible trekking excursion through the volcanic hills of the island. During your tour, you will have the opportunity to ascend to the top of the illustrious Ranu Kau volcanic caldera. Upon your arrival at the summit of Ranu Kau, you will be amazed by incredible views of all of Easter Island. At the lookout point on top of Ranu Kau, a charming picnic lunch will have been laid out for you as a reward for completing your trek. Once you have descended from the caldera, you will have the next several hours to enjoy before transferring to Tahai to watch the sunset.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Moon Valley
dayInfo.description: Today, you will have an early start and enjoy breakfast at your hotel before transferring to the Chilean mainland. Finally, you will arrive in Chile’s vast and beautiful Atacama Desert, where you will be met by your private driver and transferred to your luxurious accommodation. Once you have had time to settle in, you will indulge in an exclusive tour of the Valle de la Luna. Just before the sun begins to set, you will be transferred to a phenomenal lookout point, where you can watch the sunset against the backdrop of Moon Valley. In the evening, you will delight in a private stargazing tour, during which your guide will captivate you with local myths and legends of the constellations.

dayInfo.title: San Pedro de Atacama – Desert Sandboarding
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy a wonderful breakfast of regional Chilean fare at your hotel before meeting your personal driver in the lobby to continue your exploration of the stunning Atacama Desert. You will first transfer to the desert’s sand dunes, where you will have the unique opportunity to partake in sandboarding. In the afternoon, you will have the option to join your guide for a cycling tour or a private trek through several of the Atacama’s most noteworthy sites. In the evening, you will be returned to your elegant hotel to spend the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Cultural Show with Dinner
dayInfo.description: Today, you will fly to Santiago. Upon your arrival in Chile’s capital city, you will be met at baggage claim by your driver and transferred to your extravagant hotel. Once you have had plenty of time to settle in and freshen up from your flight, you will begin your exploration of this bustling metropolis. You will be provided with a private tour of the city’s most noteworthy cultural and historical sites. Once your tour has concluded, you will attend a Chilean cultural performance of song and dance that will be accompanied by a traditional dinner and a regional wine pairing.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – One of Santiago’s Most Illustrious Museums
dayInfo.description: You will begin your day’s tour with a visit to Santiago’s fascinating Chilean Museum of Pre-Columbian Art. Here, you will be immersed in the history that has helped to shape South America and the subsequent culture that was established as a result. After you have completed your tour of the museum, you will be transferred to the base of illustrious Cerro San Cristobal. In the charming town, you will ascend to the top of a hill by way of funicular, and once you have arrived at the mountain’s summit, you will be able to indulge in spectacular views of all of Santiago and the snow-capped Andes Mountains.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Valparaiso and Maipo Valley
dayInfo.description: When you are ready, you can meet your private guide in your hotel’s lobby for a transfer to the city of Valparaiso. Your tour will begin in the center of the city, which is Plaza Sotomayor. From there, you will ascend to the top of the Cerro Alegre via funicular, where you will be amazed by the charming shops, cafes, and restaurants that abound from the bohemian neighborhood. Once you reach the summit, you will have time to explore the charming town on your own. From Valparaiso, you will transfer to the beautiful Maipo Valley, which is Chile’s iconic wine country. Here, you will be treated to an exclusive tour of the region’s finest wineries and will have the opportunity to sample Chile’s finest wines.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Departure
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can indulge in your final breakfast in Santiago. You can spend the morning exploring the city at your leisure, enjoying a final stroll through Bellavista or stopping into a charming cafe in Lastarria. As you gaze out upon the bustling daily life of Santiago, you will begin to reminisce on your lovely Chilean journey thus far, and you may even wish that you could extend your trip for another ten days. When you are ready, you will return to your hotel to gather your belongings. Once you are ready, you will meet your driver in your hotel’s lobby for your transfer to the airport and your flight home.

tourName: Torres del Paine Photography Tour
placesVisited: Punta Arenas, Puerto Natales
generalInfo: Capture the legendary beauty and serene seclusion of Chile during your 8-day photography tour of Patagonia and the fantastical scenery of Torres del Paine National Park. The marvels of Chilean Patagonia feature ancient forests, glinting glaciers, vast pampas, and the rugged splendor of the Southern Ice Field spread against the backdrop of the Andes. Find inspiration in nature as you trek past elusive pumas and sail across sparkling translucent water to reach the soaring ledge of Grey Glacier. Discover the largest penguin colony in Chile and learn the art of capturing thrilling landscapes and wildlife under the tutelage of acclaimed photographers.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Day at Leisure in Punta Arenas
dayInfo.description: The city of Punta Arenas overlooks the Strait of Magellan in the southern corners of Chilean Patagonia. The historic port and a tradition of sheep-breeding has supported the sophisticated European architecture wrapping around Plaza Muñoz Gamero. Opulent mansions reminiscent of the regional wool-boom decorate the skyline in view of the statue of Ferdinand Magellan, which was erected to commemorate the voyager’s 400th anniversary. Your flight will land at Presidente Carlos Ibáñez del Campo International Airport, where your private transfer escorts you to the luxurious Hotel Cabo de Hornos. Your gorgeous accommodations are located in the heart of town near the main square of La Plaza Central. The building harkens back to the days when Punta Arenas stood as the capital of Chile’s “white gold” rush, referring to the quick pace and incredible demand of wool in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The cozy ambiance welcomes you to Chile with views of the stunning cityscape and reflective waters from the Strait of Magellan. The light and cheerful décor of your room effortlessly combines the history of Hotel Cabo de Hornos with the comforts of modern luxury. Before you explore the charms of Punta Arenas, you will meet with the celebrated photographer and local guide, Justin Hofman, for more insight into the remarkable adventure to come. The acclaimed photographer, scuba diver, and naturalist has a spent a career documenting wildlife acquiring an extensive knowledge of ecology and animal behavior along the way. After meeting Justin and your guide, you will set out to visit Cementerio Municipal , one of the most interesting cemeteries in South America. Elegant and opulent tombs decorate the grounds, which contrasts with the humbler graves of immigrants who often worked the farms. The grand José Menéndez’s tomb is an imitation of the Vittorio Emanuele II monument in Rome, made to scale.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Milodon Cave en route to Torres del Paine
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the herbaceous aroma of mate tea fills the dining room. After breakfast, you will leave behind the urban sprawl of Punta Arenas bound for the vast wilderness of Torres del Paine National Park. The scenic drive leading to the park fills with the verdant colors of the pampas and crop fields. Cattle graze on the open plains mirroring the past when herds of sheep fed on the abundant grass and natural herbs. Outside of Puerto Natales, you reach Milodon Cave. The natural cavern was discovered in the 1890s where the remains of a giant ground sloth reached more than 13 feet tall. The largest cave has a depth of 656 feet with a height of over 98 feet. A German merchant discovered the giant ground sloth with skin and bones intact. There were also human bones from the Paleo-Indian culture that inhabited the cave approximately 8,000 years ago. A replica of the animal stands at the mouth of the cave as it welcomes visitors to an important element of Chile’s Patagonian region. Look out over the landscape from the cave, which reveals the beauty of snowcapped mountains in the background and lush forestry in the foreground. You will arrive at Hotel Las Torres Patagonia, located inside Torres del Paine National Park. The superb location provides picturesque panoramas and private viewpoints to mountains, glaciers, lakes, and rivers. The organic garden grows fresh, delicious vegetables, the stables host horses eager to ferry you into the pampas, and the spa offers a relaxing, refreshing touch in the comforts of your luxury accommodations. The easy access to Mirador de Torres trekking route will add to the luster of your gorgeous surroundings on the historic grounds of a former cattle farm.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Panoramas and Condors with a Viewpoints
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sunlight spreads across Tores del Paine National Park to return the luster of the pampas and the brilliant sheen of the glaciers capping the massif. After breakfast, you will start the day at Salto Grande, an impressive cascade of the Paine River. The glassy turquoise water splashes down 213 feet into the roiling river. The breeze carries the mist along the greenery lining the rocky banks. The falls connect the vast waters of Lake Nordenskjöld and Lake Pehoe. You continue along a steady outcrop that leads to views of Los Cuernos , or the Horns of Patagonia. The peaks create a silhouette of jagged, inspiring granite piercing the sky at 9,462 feet above sea level. Your guide offers insight into capturing the best photos of the remarkable peaks. He will teach you to use passing clouds or natural light for contrast and depth. The natural marvels of Torres del Paine continue when you reach the Condor Viewpoint. Marvel at the massive wingspan of the largest flying bird in South America, the Andean condor. They gracefully glide along the wind using air-pockets to suspend themselves in the sky with little effort due to their enormous wingspan reaching an average 10 feet wide. They circle the sky looking for carrion. You will capture remarkable photos of their serene, effortless flight for a memento of your time at the Condor Lookout perched above the crystalline waters of Laguna Sofia.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Western Lakes Scenery and Sail to Grey Glacier
dayInfo.description: You set out with Justin Hofman in the morning to the shores of Grey Lake for a sailing expedition to the edge of the eponymous glacier. The scenic drive features stunning views of the Paine Torres and the subtle shimmer of the granite of Los Cuernos in the sunlight. You will have a chance to practice some of the photography techniques you are learning along the way when you stop in a beech forest. Snapshots of the evergreen and deciduous leaves and the fruits and nuts of trees averaging 200 years old. The woodlands were gradually reforested around 10,000 years ago when the glaciers retreated. You arrive at the banks of Grey Lake and board a boat along the placid waters. The cool, crisp wind bites at your cheeks and carries the scent of ice in the air. The lake has a surface area of more than 12.5 square miles reaching a maximum depth of 1,640 feet born from Southern Patagonian Ice Field. As you near the edge of the glacier, icebergs bobble in the dark glowing water. South Andean deer often grace the woods near the lakeshores but the stunning, timid animal remains mostly elusive around groups of people. Grey Glacier flows southward into the lake and stops at its natural wall reaching over 98 feet tall. The entire glacier encompasses a total area of 100 square miles. The fantastical image recreates a storybook landscape easily photographed with sensational accuracy. When the boat travels close to the ice sheet, you will swear you can hear the ice cracking, ready to calve away from the wall and crash into the waiting water.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Photo Safari and Puma Tracking Excursion
dayInfo.description: The wildlife in the remarkable ecosystem of Torres del Paine National Park is as captivating as the landscape. The trails call to you in the early morning so you set out in search of the puma, often referred to as the “King of Patagonia.” As you walk along the trail, you keep an eye open for the South American gray fox, guanaco, and armadillo. There are 118 separate species of Southern birds populating the national park including the Chilean Flicker and the Magellanic Woodpecker. You can easily hear the woodpecker before you spot it in the trees pecking against the bark in search of food. Their solid black body shines with white patches along the wings beneath a bright crimson crest along the head. You will follow tracking specialists on a private ranch and learn the important details for tracking a puma in the wilderness. The sun rises over the gorgeous landscape to reveal the lush greenery of the woodlands amid striking lens flares. The puma is most active in the morning and at night when the temperatures are cooler. The Andean puma remains elusive. It is the largest feline in the Americas growing to nearly six and a half feet long, not including its tail, and weighing up to 121 pounds. Their size generally fluctuates depending on their habitat’s climate so there is an increase in weight and length when they live in colder climates and higher altitudes. Male pumas live solitary, territorial lives covering thousands of acres. They are active climbers, short-distance sprinters, and possess a keen sense of smell, as well as night vision. You return to searching for the puma, after a rest in the afternoon, which will increase your chances of sighting one of the most mysterious animals in Patagonia.

dayInfo.title: Torres del Paine – Absorbing Hike to the Base of Cerro Torres
dayInfo.description: After an early breakfast, you begin the demanding hike to the base of the Torres, the iconic towers for which Torres del Paine is named. The hike takes approximately nine hours and requires a good level of fitness before embarking on the trail. The rewards are worth the challenge as you make your way back into the marvelous landscape of the national park by crossing the River Ascencio en route to Paso de Los Vientos. An ancient beech forest springs up along the glassy slopes of the valley while the water from the River Ascencio splashes against the rocky banks. You will have a stunning view of the dense forest sweeping over the river valley from the Base Las Torres Trail leading into the glaciated mountains. The winding pathway becomes rocky along the granite boulders as you ascend into Paso de Los Vientos at 1,575 feet above sea level. Pause for a moment to enjoy the majestic view of the verdant pampa and glassy lakes. You continue from the Chilean Camp up the moraine, an accumulation of dirt and rocks fallen from the glacier’s surface. The unstable slopes become a worthwhile obstacle when you reach the stable plateau in view of the Torres and Cuernos del Paine. The photogenic rock formations reach staggering heights at nearly 6,562 feet above sea level. The light glints against the glaciers and granite for epic photos that will memorialize your journey to the base in addition to the natural splendor of the massif.

dayInfo.title: Punta Arenas – Scenic Punta Arenas by way of Puerto Natales
dayInfo.description: In the soothing, refreshing comforts of the Hotel Las Torres Patagonia, you will find the herbaceous aroma of mate tea brewing in the dining room. The gauchos have taken out the horses into the pampas. Your escort will take you back to the civilized streets and elegant European architecture of Punta Arenas. Stop at Puerto Natales along the way to spend time in a former fishing port along the Magellan Strait. Corrugated-tin houses stand shoulder to shoulder along the shoreline to highlight the historic architecture of the city’s past while cozy lodges have sprung up in the heart of town. The relaxed pace continues amid seaside aroma as you continue to Punta Arenas via Ruta 9, which boasts spectacular views of the Mountains. In the city, you can embark on a number of activities at your preferred pace. The Instituto de la Patagonia features a fantastic collection of historical maps in addition to historical and scientific publications.
